In 2016, ZEvA, Germany’s first accreditation agency, evaluated and accredited all University’s undergraduate and postgraduate programs. In 2019, the Advisory Board of the MBA Association (AMBA) accredited the MBA and Executive MBA programs of the MGIMO Business School. The same year MGIMO joined the European Foundation for Management Development (EFMD) –the most revered professional association in management and business education.

name: Paris Lodron University of Salzburg
description:
Paris Lodron University Salzburg PLUS is the largest educational institution in Salzburg with almost 18,000 students and around 2,900 employees in research, teaching and administration. The University is an integral part of both cultural and economic life, and is a meeting point for teachers and students, academia and the local community. The name of our university reflects its founding by Prince Archbishop Paris Lodron in 1622. Since its re-establishment in 1962, the University of Salzburg has become a modern and vibrant university.

Many of the University’s facilities are housed in some architecturally breath-taking buildings in Salzburg’s city centre. The Faculty of Natural Sciences in Freisaal and UNIPARK in Nonntal make up the modern university campus. Further locations include those in Itzling and Rif, as well as further afield in Linz, Krems and Vienna.

The University of Salzburg offers a wide spectrum of educational opportunities. Students can choose from 30 different degree programmes. They are divided into Bachelor’s, Master’s, PhD and diploma programmes. Students are free to choose their own focus areas and can add supplementary courses in various disciplines. In addition, the University of Salzburg offers numerous part-time University Programmes for Further Education, some of which are run together with other educational institutions.

For further information please visit www.plus.ac.at

name: Universidad de la República (Udelar)
description: Universidad de la República, sometimes UdelaR is Uruguay's public university, the most important, oldest, and largest university of the country. It was founded on July 18, 1849 in Montevideo, where most of its buildings and facilities are still located.

name: University of Brescia
description:
The University of Brescia offers a wide range of educational programs
with Bachelor and Master of Science (MSc) degrees, postgraduate technical
courses, specialization schools, and Ph.D. programs in most areas: business and
economics, engineering and technology, law, medicine and surgery, and
dentistry. In 2024 it offers 28 undergraduate Degree programs, 27 postgraduate,
and 12 Doctoral Degree programs.The University of Brescia aims at enhancing
research and addressing the educational needs of the European and global
communities, by promoting collaboration and integration. The University of
Brescia promotes initiatives aimed at internationalization, European and
international exchange agreements, and cooperation programs to encourage
student and researcher mobility. The result is a good choice of double degree
study programs, courses taught in English, and international summer schools,
together with highly-recognized scientific research and important international
awards. At present, the University of Brescia counts around
260 active financed research projects, 43 international and 220 nationally
funded projects. Among the European ones, 25 projects were funded within the
7th Framework Programme and 27 within Horizon 2020. The University participated
in various European programs such as Horizon Europe, COST actions, LIFE,
Erasmus+, Justice Programme, CERV, EU4Health and is currently participating in
13 projects within Horizon Europe.   The University is Host Institution of an ERC-2019 Starting
Grant and an ERC-2021-Consolidator Grant  .The mission of the University of Brescia is to
focus our activities on the health and wealth of people in the surrounding
environment, through the integration of cultural and scientific areas which are
the hallmark of our University, and the collaboration with the vibrant system
of enterprises, especially in the areas of manufacturing, mechatronics and
biotechnologies, digital economy, law, and innovation. Strong links are
established with national and international partners working in the health,
economic-industrial and socio-institutional fields, in order to generate
knowledge, educate the new generations and actively participate in the progress
of Brescia, of Italy, and, in general, of the world. Special attention is paid
to the sustainability of our development and the inclusiveness with respect to
gender, nationality, and freedom of thinking and faith of our students and
staff. As a result of a balanced blend of research impact, quality of teaching,
and links with a healthy economy, the employability of graduates at the
University of Brescia is at the top in Italy.

name: China University of Mining and Technology
Konkuk University
description:
Konkuk University (KU) was founded in 1931 and since that time has become a significant force in Korean and global higher education. All our programs are fully accredited by the Korean Ministry of Education and other external organizations such as the Accreditation Board for Engineering in Korea (ABEEK). Our Business School is fully accredited by the Association to Advance Collegiate Schools of Business (AACSB). Enrolling about, 30,000 students, at two campus locations, in Seoul’s vibrant Gangnam District, and Chungju’s pristine rural environment, KU, conducts, a comprehensive range of educational and research activities. As a globally engaged university, we educate, 2,500 international students across abroad range of disciplines, in undergraduate, graduate, and post-doctorate programs. To accommodate our Konkuk Global Exchange Network (K-GEN) spanning 67 countries, we provide English-taught programs that vary in length including shorter-term summer programs. The K-GEN is strategically integrated across all disciplinary research and educational activities.

KU rankings are as follows; QS World in 2019: #581-590 QS Asia in 2019: #94 QS Subjects in 2018: especially #151-200 in Agriculture & Forestry, #201-250 in Chemical Engineering

name: University of Agriculture, Faisalabad
description:
The challenges to world agriculture include ever growing human population, climate change and limiting natural resources where the University of Agriculture, Faisalabad (UAF), the undisputed standard bearer of South Asia in the realm of higher education and research in agriculture, realizes its responsibility to meet the current and future needs to ensure food security and mitigate the challenge. The UAF evolved in the early 60s from an agriculture college founded in 1906 by upgrading the former Punjab Agricultural College and Research Institute, Lyallpur, (Faisalabad) that was, in its own right, a widely acclaimed institution. UAF has its roots in early days of canal colonies which played a significant role to ensure food security in a country facing repeated famines. It has been providing leadership since the days of Green Revolution. UAF graduates created poultry industry which is second largest sector of country's economy since 1970s and revolutionized cotton cultivation which has based the top segment of Pakistan's economy, the textiles industry since 1980s.. The Islamic Development Bank (1DB) awarded UAF with the S&T prize 2012 on the basis of its contribution promoting science and technology. The selection of UAF to establish the Center for Advanced Studies in Food Security/Agriculture by USAID and HEC is a vivid example of its competence and excellence. UAF achieved the NTU ranking in 2013, 2014, 2015, 2016, 2017 and The QS Top Universities Ranking in 2013, 2014, 2015,  2016, 2017 in the subject category (agriculture and forestry). UAF achieved UI GreenMetric World University Ranking in 2013, 2014, 2015, 2016 while the Times Higher Education World University Ranking 2017 and 2018. To date, the university has produced 1587 PhD, 5002 MPhil/MS, 38559 MSc (Hons.)/MSc/MBA, and 33614 BSc (Hons.)/DVM. The university has 696 on-going research projects including PhD projects worth 2547.52 million rupees while 2266 research projects worth 29211.47 million rupees have been submitted to various funding agencies. UAF has signed 142 international, 29 national and 41 private MoUs to uplift the research culture and to promote faculty and student exchange programs.

UAF has achieved a number of milestones in its research programs and transfer of knowledge and technology to the stakeholders. Salient achievements include: introduction and development of new varieties and hybrids of citrus (Kinnow Mandarin from California USA, and Feutral's Early from Australia), vegetables (PARS-70 of potato), wheat (LU-26, SARC-1, SARC­5, 9272, 9476, elite line WV-1038), cotton (LSS, PB-38), chickpea (AUG-209), mungbean (yellow Mosaic virus resistant 56-2), lentil (Strain AUL 18-10), maize (synthetic UM-1), Maize Pro-vitamin A, HP-1097-2, HP-1097-11, HP-1097-18, Brassica (UAF-11), sunflower (elite lines, G-2, G-5, G-68, G­72), sorghum (elite lines, PBG-Sorg-I and PBG-Sorg-II) cotton variety PB-896  and chicken breeds (Lyallpur Silver Black and UniGold). In addition to the above crop varieties and animal breeds, the scientists at UAF have developed a number of technologies (farm implements and vaccines) for improved production, protection and commercialization of agricultural products and commodities and are available (101-Innovation Catalogue). Please see contents of Innovation Catalogue. http://uaf.edu.pk/Catalouge/101/contents.html

name: Université de Lille
description:
The University of Lille is based in the French town of Lille, located to the north of the country near the border with Belgium. The university was formed by a merger of three universities: Lille University of Science and Technology, Lille 2 University of Health and Law, and Charles de Gaulle University - Lille III.In its new, combined form, the university has become one of the largest in not just France but also the French-speaking world. 67,000 students are currently enrolled, studying degrees across six academic study areas:

As with many western towns and cities, employment in Lille has become more focused on tertiary activities and services over the last 20 years. Graduates from the university will find a thriving jobs market in the fields of commerce and business, but may feel a need to move away after graduation if their desired career is in other areas (i.e. engineering).

name: Bar-Ilan University
description: Due to its ideal  location, the BIU campus is easily accessible to students arriving from all regions of the country, just 20 minutes away from Tel Aviv and 45 minutes from Jerusalem. With ample parking and public transportation in the area, students will find Bar-Ilan’s location to be central and accessible. It was even awarded the title  “Most Beautiful Academic Campus” by the Council for a Beautiful Israel!

name: Ca' Foscari University of Venice
description:
Originally established as Italy’s first international business school in
1868, Ca’ Foscari University of Venice is now a midsize public university offering programmes in the humanities, the social sciences, and science and technology.

Based in Venice, the university offers all the advantages of being at the heart of one of Europe’s most inspiring and dynamic cultural hubs. At the same time, it fosters a markedly global atmosphere thanks to the presence of a large community of international faculty, researchers and students. In fact, Ca’ Foscari brings the world to its campuses thanks to the dozens of English-taught undergraduate, master’s and doctoral degrees it offers. It also makes sure that its students venture beyond its campuses and local context by encouraging them to take advantage of a wide variety of joint/double degree options and international exchange programmes. Moreover, as a public institution with significant government support that genuinely believes in making excellent international education accessible to all, its tuition fees are remarkably affordable, even for international students.

The university's teaching and research are carried out by 7 departments and the Venice School of Management, an EQUIS-accredited business school, which offer degree programs in the following fields:

CAMPUSES

Ca' Foscari has multiple campuses dedicated to specific study areas:

Ca' Foscari also has a campus in the nearby city of Treviso that hosts its School of Economics, Languages and Entrepreneurship, as well as a partnership with H-Farm College in Roncade that has students enrolled in the undergraduate degree in Digital Management attend classes on the H-Farm Campus.

RESOURCES. FACILITIES AND SERVICES

STUDENT LIFE

Beyond the university sphere, the city of Venice ensures that you are immersed in cultural enrichment. Whether they are taking advantage of the international events that draw crowds from around the world such as the international Venice Biennale dedicated to contemporary art, or exploring the city's artistic and architectural beauty, they are always soaking up the experiences that only Europe's greatest cultural capitals can offer. Moreover, the pedestrian city centre facilitates a sustainable lifestyle while fostering a wonderfully spontaneous social dynamic, with student life unfolding not only on the university's campuses but also throughout the city's public spaces.

For more information about Ca' Foscari, visit www.unive.it/english.

name: Kingston University, London
description:
We’re proud to be ranked a top 5 university in London for 21 subject areas. The University topped the national tables for interior design and was named second in the country for fashion and textiles and mental health nursing - as well as being the top ranked London institution for both subject areas. Kingston was also top in the capital for children's nursing, graphic design, and midwifery. In architecture and forensic science the University was positioned second in London and third in London for film production and photography (Guardian league table, 2023).

Kingstonprovides the ideal study
location. The university is located in a student-friendly riverside town of
Kingston upon Thames, that’s just a short train ride from the centre of London.

There’s a lot happening at
Kingston. Town House, located at our Penrhyn Road campus has recently won the
2021 RIBA Stirling Prize for Britain’s best new building and provides
outstanding study facilities for students, including a new library with over 1,000
study spaces, flexible learning areas, a covered courtyard, cafes, dance
studios and roof top gardens.

At Kingston, you’ll be connected
to a range of activities aimed to help you develop inside and outside of the
classroom, from studying abroad to learning a new language with our free,
Kingston Language Scheme. Some of the best things about going to university are
all the clubs and societies that you can join, and at Kingston you can choose
from over 100 of them.

There’s no better opportunity to
find out if Kingston University is the place for you then attending one of our
Open Days.

name: Memorial University of Newfoundland
description: Founded in 1925 as a memorial to Newfoundland's war dead, Memorial University College was elevated to degree-granting status in 1949. When Newfoundland became a province of Canada that year, one of the first legislative actions of the new government was to pass An Act Respecting the Memorial University of Newfoundland. The Act specifies the role, responsibilities, structure and other governance and administrative aspects of the province’s only university.Today about 19,000 students are enrolled in Memorial’s undergraduate, graduate and professional programs which span a wide range of disciplines. Memorial is committed to student-centred and experiential learning in multiple modes and settings. The university has key locations are in St. John's and Corner Brook in Newfoundland, Happy Valley-Goose Bay in Labrador, and Harlow in England and offers extensive on-line courses and programs.With a bicameral system of governance like many Canadian universities, Memorial University has a Senate that oversees academic affairs and a Board of Regents that oversees all other matters. The institutional leader is the president and vice-chancellor, who is supported by the university’s administrative leadership.

name: COMSATS University Islamabad
description:
COMSATS University Islamabad (CUI) is a young public university with a comprehensive focus and all its programs in English. Pursuing its 3-fold mission of Teaching & Learning; Research & Discovery; Outreach & Public Service, CUI boasts a national profile of excellent academic reputation and now is in step with the current pace of international development while maintaining its own academic background.

CUI is a multi-campus Institute offering degree programs in the fields of Science, Engineering, Technology, Architecture & Design, Business, Humanities, etc. Currently, there are seven physical campuses of CUI, with its primary campus at Islamabad (1998), Abbottabad (2001), Wah (2001), Lahore (2002), Attock (2004), Sahiwal (2006), and Vehari (2008) along with a Virtual Campus (2012).

Vision

The CUI envisions assuming a truly national character for itself in the years to come. It sees for itself a position among top 100 universities in the developing countries and top 500 universities in the world by 2020. Focus in the period 2005-10 was on science led engineering, while in the period 2010-15 on initiating social sciences programs. During 2015-20, the focus will be on establishing programs in medical and agricultural sciences.

name: Indian Institute of Technology Hyderabad (IITH)
description:
As an institute with just 14 years of its existence, IIT Hyderabad (IITH) is doing well, almost on par with some of the first-generation IITs. With the ranking of 9th among all the engineering institutes, Top-12 Research Institutes in the country and 14th overall rank in the country as per NIRF and with being within the Top-7 ranks among technical institutes from India in QS world rankings & entry to Top 600 Club in the World Ranking as per QS World Rankings make IITH stands tall. This is essentially due to over 286 dynamic young faculty of the institute with an average age of about 39, who work hard and take up challenges without the fear of failure, putting IITH at the forefront of R&D innovations. A healthy faculty-to-student ratio of 1:15 and a good mix of UG and PG programs with a UG to PG to PhD ratio of ~40:30:30 makes IITH a unique place for teaching and research. The strong research culture at IITH is reflected in around 1700+ sponsored research projects of Rs. 535+ Crores that our faculty members have been handling, with the last year’s funds inflow being more than Rs. 5150 Crores. Recently IITH has made a mark by making India the First 5G SoC IoT ‘koala’ & World's Smallest Microscope ‘Muscope’. The number of Scopus-indexed publications in the last 14 years is close to 7500+, reflecting the thriving research activity. IITH has a strong start-up culture with a dedicated space for incubation and a research park. With about 1.5 lakh sqft of space each for the above activities, which will significantly boost the entrepreneurship activity at IITH.

The fractal academics with an interdisciplinary approach, with departments such as AI, Climate Change, Engineering sciences, and interdisciplinary PhD provide a unique academic atmosphere at IITH. The BTech program in AI, Biomedical Engineering (1st introduced among the IIT system), along with eight industry-oriented MTech Programs in 2020, three Industry Oriented BTech Programs in Computational Engineering, Industrial Chemistry & Bioinformatics started in 2021 & IC Design in 2022, 9 MTech & MDes Online Programs, MTech in Techno-Entrepreneurship, FIRST Fellowship for Scholars of Foreign National, a minor in entrepreneurship, Executive MTech in Data Science together with the Design and Liberal Arts departments represent the unique and diversified academic fabric of IITH. The institute has taken up several industry-oriented measures this year. A semester-long internship in the 6th semester for BTech/BDes students and a mandatory 1-credit course on “Industry Lectures” are a few. At least 50% of MTech projects from now on will be on industry-defined problems. Several new industry-oriented MTech programs such as Additive manufacturing (with DRDO support), E-waste resource engineering & management (jointly with C-MET, Hyderabad, and with MeitY support), Medical device innovation (jointly with AIG, Hyderabad), Energy science & technology, Integrated sensor systems, Network & information security, Polymers & biosystems engineering and Smart mobility, will enhance our outreach to industry. IITH is also planning to introduce Online for other disciplines so that industry experts can boost their academics and perform well in their fields of interest.

name: Birla Institute of Technology and Science, Pilani
Karl-Franzens-Universitaet Graz
description: The University of Graz was founded in 1585, which makes it Austria's second oldest university. Students can find here many scientists and have the opportunity to study where six Nobel laureates completed their studies. The university is located in Graz, Austria and is one of the largest in the country. The institution has six different faculties and approximately 120 study courses.

name: East China University of Science and Technology
Stevens Institute of Technology
description: Stevens Institute of Technology is a premier, private research university situated in Hoboken, New Jersey overlooking the Manhattan skyline. Since our founding in 1870, technological innovation has always been the hallmark and legacy of Stevens’ education and research. Within the university’s three schools and one college, 6,900 undergraduate and graduate students collaborate closely with faculty in an interdisciplinary, student-centric, entrepreneurial environment. Academic and research programs spanning business, computing, engineering, the arts and other fields actively advance the frontiers of science and leverage technology to confront our most pressing global challenges. The university is consistently ranked among the nation’s elite for return on tuition investment, career services and the mid-career salaries of alumni. Stevens is home to two national research centers of excellence as well as interdisciplinary research programs in artificial intelligence and cybersecurity; data science and information systems; complex systems and networks; financial systems and technologies; biomedical engineering, healthcare and life sciences; and resilience and sustainability. Stevens is currently in the midst of executing a 10-year strategic plan, The Future. Ours to Create., which is growing and transforming the university, further extending the Stevenslegacy to create a forward-looking, far-reaching institution with global impact.

name: TU Dortmund University
description:
Since its founding 50 years ago, TU Dortmund  University has  developed a special profile encompassing 16 faculties ranging from  science and engineering to social sciences and culture studies.

TU Dortmund University has a strong focus on research. The  university’s disciplines, e.g. mechanical engineering with its emphasis  on production and logistics, physics, biochemical- and chemical  engineering, statistics and computer science, as well as education  research, are well known for their outstanding research achievements  both nationally and internationally.

Students at TU Dortmund University can choose from classical subjects  and innovative courses of study such as medical physics or  degree programs in spatial planning, statistics and journalism. A  particular focus is on teacher training. As one of only a few  universities in Germany, TU Dortmund University offers professional  teaching qualifications for all types of schools.

TU Dortmund University attaches great importance to social and  sustainable development – values to which it is strongly committed. As  one of the largest employers in Dortmund, the university promotes the  development and health of its members and supports good working  conditions and equal opportunities.

TU Dortmund University is driving forward the transformation of the  city and the Ruhr area into a high-tech and service location and  cultural metropolis. In the immediate vicinity of the campus, the  TechnologieZentrumDortmund promotes the economic application of ideas  from science. The lively exchange with neighbors in the region, but also  with partners in Europe and around the world, is a special enrichment  for students, scientists and all employees.

name: Beirut Arab University
description: Located in the Lebanese capital city of Beirut, Beirut Arab University is home to over 16,000 students and is one of the top universities in the Arab region. As well as its urban campus in Beirut, the university also has a suburban campus in Debbieh and another campus in Tripoli. Teaching at the university spans 10 different faculties, including engineering, medicine, science, and business administration. All programs are taught in English apart from some degrees offered by the Faculties of Arts and Law. More information about the English language admissions requirements can be found on the university website.

name: Jadavpur University
description:
Jadavpur University is one of the premier University in India located at Kolkata. The university has four faculties, namely Faculty of Arts, Faculty of Engineering and Technology, Faculty of Science and Faculty of Interdisciplinary Schools, Law & Management. The last one started in 2013 after the successful functioning of a large number of interdisciplinary schools in the University, both in the areas of research and teaching. In the recent NIRF ranking, Jadavpur University secured fifth rank in the University list, ninth rank in Engineering and twelfth rank in the overall list. It is the topmost among the state universities in the country. The 2017 Times Higher Education ranking accorded Jadavpur University the first position among all the universities of the country. The university has been ranked with ‘A‘ Grade with a CGPA credit of 3.68 out of 4.00 during the last assessment of NAAC, held in 2014. These accolades are the reflection of the highest quality of academic activities carried out in the University.

Jadavpur University also executes various prestigious academic and research programs, which are the reflection of the top merit of the faculty members, research scholars, and students associated with the University. The University is one of the nation’s first universities to be brought under the ambit of the University Grants Commission’s scheme of Universities with Potential for Excellent (UPE). The UGC has also granted ten departments of the University with the Centre of Advanced Studies (CAS) status, two departments the status of the Department of Special Assistance (DSA) and five departments the position of Department of Research Support (DRS) under the Special Assistance Program (SAP). The University is a leading partner in the European Union (EU) Project E-QUAL, designed to enhancing Quality, Access and Governance of undergraduate education in India. The University has started building the Tagore Cultural Complex with a total grant of 15 crores from the Central and State governments, a feat which is only one of its kind within the University system of the country. The University has successfully completed World Bank sponsored TEQIP-II programme encompassing research in cutting edge areas of technological science. A special centre of excellence (COE) has been launched under the same program to undertake research on “Phase Transformation and Product Characterization”.

Jadavpur University is a public state university located in Kolkata, West Bengal.

It has two campuses: the main campus at Jadavpur and the new campus at Salt Lake, approximately 12.6 kilometres (7.8 mi) and 8.8 kilometres (5.5 mi) from the city centre respectively. A third campus is due to open at the site of the erstwhile National Instruments (CSIR India), opposite the main campus along the Raja S.C. Mullick Road.

name: American University in Dubai
description:
The American University in Dubai is a private, academically and culturally inclusive institution of higher learning, providing a globally recognized American education.

AUD is accredited by the Southern Association of Colleges and Schools Commission on Colleges (SACSCOC) in the USA and is officially licensed by the UAE Ministry of Education.

The School of Business Administration at AUD is AACSB accredited, providing the Master of Business Administration MBA - a world-class graduate qualification for graduates who aspire to leadership and management roles within the business administration fields. Designed in collaboration with the top-ranked SC Johnson College of Business at Cornell University, the Executive Master of Business Administration (EMBA) at AUD will equip you with the skills and knowledge you need to thrive as a transformational leader.

The School of Architecture, Art, and Design is the first and only school outside of the USA to have obtained the three primary accreditations (NAAB (National Architectural Accrediting Board), CIDA (Council for Interior Design Accreditation), and NASAD (National Association of Schools of Art and Design).

The programs of AUD’s School of Engineering are accredited by the Engineering Accreditation Commission of ABET.

The Bachelor of Communication and Information Studies (B.C.I.S.) program is accredited by ACEJMC.

name: University of Haifa
description: The University of Haifa, established in 1972, is an academic institution whose initial and central function is to carry out excellent academic teaching and research. The academic excellence is showcased in many various interdisciplinary and international programs and by means of collaborations with academic institutions around the world. The University of Haifa is a developing and dynamic institution with a world-renowned reputation in many different fields of research, and it is the leading University in Israel in the fields of the Humanities, Social Sciences, Law, Welfare and Health Sciences, Natural Sciences, Education and Management. The University was selected by the Council for Higher Education to lead the field of Marine Research as well as the field of Education in a Networked Society. The University offers 20 international academic programs in the English language which attract many excellent students from Israel and abroad. The University is situated atop Mount Carmel, where Haifa’s southern boundary verges on the Carmel National Park which is one of the most beautiful places in Israel, and over 18,000 students study here for their undergraduate, graduate and doctoral Degrees.

name: HUFS - Hankuk (Korea) University of Foreign Studies
description: Since its founding in 1954, Hankuk University of Foreign Studies (HUFS) has played a significant role in reconstructing Korea after the Korean War by producing numerous CEOs and outstanding diplomats, who are competitive enough to strive forward in the global stage. HUFS is currently teaching 45 foreign languages, and stands as the number one global university in Korea. Combining studies in the humanities, law, social sciences, business, and computer science, students naturally grow as global leaders, equipped with both professional knowledge and language proficiency. HUFS has various programs that meet the ambitions of young people. Through the 7+1 Study Abroad Program, HUFS supports students to study at least one of eight semesters in a foreign country.

name: Nanjing University of Aeronautics and Astronautics
Universitas Brawijaya
description: Universitas Brawijaya (UB) is located in the city of Malang, East Java province, Indonesia. UB was officially declared by the President of the Republic of Indonesia on January 5th 1963. There are 18 faculties held in UB. Visions: To be an outstanding university and play an active role as an agent of change to the society through education, research and community services complies with the national and international standard. Mission: To conduct professional teaching-learning process. To promote awareness to the existence of God's creations and appreciation of human and other creatures rights. To conduct academic process that educates the students to be highly competent graduates and qualified professionals. To innovate, develop, and disseminate sciences and technologies, to empower community welfare and enhance the national culture.

name: Comenius University Bratislava
description:
Comenius University in Bratislavais Slovakia’s leading university — and the only one in the country consistently ranked among the world’s top institutions. With a strong tradition and a forward-looking vision, it offers students a vibrant European educational experience.

With13 facultiesand more than800accredited programmes,both in English and Slovak,  across all levels of higher education, the university offers thebroadest study portfolio in Slovakia. Many of these programmes are unique nationwide, making Comenius a top choice for students interested in specialised or interdisciplinary fields.

Its academic offer covers a wide range of disciplines — frommedicine, natural sciences, and mathematicstolaw, humanities, theology, and social sciences. Students also benefit from aresearch-driven environment, with opportunities to join innovative projects, apply for grants, and gain experience through internships both at home and abroad.

Comenius University is also themost international Slovak university, sending the highest number of Slovak students abroad each year and welcoming the largest community of international students in the country. With students from across Europe and far beyond, it offers a truly global campus in the heart of Europe.

name: Ton Duc Thang University
description:
Ton Duc Thang University (TDTU) is one of the young universities in Vietnam, with headquarters located in vibrant Ho Chi Minh City, where it focuses on developing the country's economic and educational resources. TDTU has been focusing on holistic human development with the goal of becoming a research university for sustainable development in Vietnam in the twenty-first century. TDTU, which was established in 1997, has been gradually becoming one of the largest and fastest-growing universities in Vietnam. The inauguration of TDTU's Tan Phong campus is an important milestone marking the development of the university, which provides learners with modern facilities and state-of-the-art equipment. Moreover, the TDTU has four other campuses, including one near Nha Trang Beach, one in Lam Dong Province, and one in Ca Mau Province. The university has approximately 26,000 students and 1,800 staff members with 16 faculties, 27 research groups, and 93 undergraduate, graduate, and doctoral programs with a wide range of interdisciplinary research opportunities. In addition, the university has been focusing on research, high-quality training, and internationalization.

In addition, TDTU provides many scholarships for university students, which is an opportunity to help students improve their knowledge and their lives.

Graduate Scholarship Programs at Ton Duc Thang University (TDTU)

* Spring semester admission: ✓ Applications Open: middle of July annually  ✓ Applications Deadline: middle of November annually ✓ Enrollment and Spring semester start: middle of February annually

* Fall semester admission:  ✓ Applications Open: middle of January annually ✓ Applications Deadline: end of May annually ✓ Enrollment and Fall semester start: middle of July annually

PART 1:MASTER’S PROGRAMS: 18 majors (https://grad.tdtu.edu.vn/en/academic/master-program)

PART 2:PhD’s PROGRAMS(Medium of instruction in English): 6 majors (https://grad.tdtu.edu.vn/en/academic/National-Doctoral-Program)

• Scholarship policies: ✓ Total tuition fee of the master's program for the whole program in 2 years Medium of instruction in Vietnamese: $2000 - $2200  Medium of instruction in English: $5000 ✓ Total Fee tuition fee of PhD’s program: $7000 for the whole program in 3~4 years; ✓ Vietnamese Language tuition fee: $800 - $1500 for 4 months (A2 level) to 10 months (B2 level); ✓ Dormitory: $30/month; ✓ Every admission time, according to the scholarship criteria, the TDTU’s scholarship committee will review and award scholarships to international students, which include three levels of scholarship: 100%, 50%, and 25% (https://grad.tdtu.edu.vn/en/cost-and-funding).

• Entrance Requirements: Master’s applicants must prepare the following documents: ✓ Application form (apply online) ✓ Up-to-date CV ✓ Original copy of bachelor's transcript in a relevant applied major ✓ Original copy of bachelor's certificate in a relevant applied major ✓ Statement of purpose (500 words) ✓ English Language Proficiency for Master programs taught in English: TOEIC 600, TOEFL iBT 50, IELTS 5.5, PET/FCE 160 (English certificates must be

SGS-School of Graduate Studies 2

* Valid for two years from your test date up to the application date) or Proof of bachelor/master program taught in English. ✓ English Language Proficiency for Master program taught in Vietnamese: TOEFL iBT 45, IELTS 4.5 (English certificates must be valid for two years from your test date up to the application date) or Proof of bachelor/master program taught in English. ✓ Copy of passport ✓ Photograph (3x4cm) ✓ Medical check

* PhD’s applicants also need to submit the above as well as the following documents: ✓ Original copy of master’s transcript in a relevant applied major ✓ Original copy of the master’s certificate in a relevant applied major ✓ English Language Proficiency for foreign applicants applying for scholarships: TOEFL iBT 60, IELTS 6.0 (English certificates must be valid for two years from your test date up to the application date) or Proof of bachelor's or master's program taught in English. ✓ Research publications (all files of published papers) ✓ Research proposal ✓ Two reference letters (one of which must be from your master’s thesis advisor)

* Application Procedure:

✓ How to Apply: Online Application: gradadmissions.tdtu.edu.vn

✓ Contact email:[email protected]

✓ Website: https://grad.tdtu.edu.vn/en

name: Cyprus University of Technology
description: Cyprus University of Technology (“CUT”) is a newly established, state university in Cyprus. It was founded by law in 2004, and accepted its first students in September 2007.CUT aspires to become a modern, innovative and pioneering university with international recognition that promotes excellence in education and research in cutting-edge areas with scientific, technological and economic impact for the betterment of Cyprus, the European Union and the world.CUT is a dynamic university with six faculties and 13 academic departments, offering academic degree programs both in undergraduate and postgraduate (MA, MSc, PhD) levels in the following fields: Engineering and Technology, Management and Economics, Health Sciences, Geotechnical Sciences and Environmental Management, Communication and Media Studies, Fine and Applied Arts.CUT research and academic staff is involved in more than 340 projects with a total funding/ contribution over 50m euro. The research projects are funded under the HORIZON2020, the FP7, the ERASMUS+ and Lifelong Learning Programme, the National Framework Programmes of the Cyprus Research Promotion Foundation, the European Territorial Cooperation Programmes (INTERREG), the COST Programme, the LIFE+, the EUROSTARS, etc.The international orientation of the University is reflected in its track record of collaborations with world leading research and educational organisations and also in the opportunities offered to students and staff through its active participation in mobility and exchange programmes, including Erasmus+ and IAESTE.The University is housed in renovated historic as well as modern buildings within and around the old historical city centre of Limassol. The presence of the University has converted and continuously upgraded the traditional town centre into a youthful, creative and vibrant part the city. Limassol is a safe destination which has much to offer, with its beautiful seafronts, countless cultural, recreational and leisure activities, as well as exciting events and festivals.

name: Baku State University
description:
Established: 1919Location: Baku, AzerbaijanFaculties: 16Staff: Over 3,000 personnel, with professors and teaching staff comprising
more than halfStudent Enrollment: Over 25,000 students, including a Branch, a College, Research Institutes and a Lyceum

Baku State University isthe oldest and largest
university in Azerbaijan, renowned as the premier educational institution
in the country. It has been the academic home to many of Azerbaijan's most
influential figures. BSU continues to grow as a leading university in the
region, fostering innovative ideas in education, enhancing capabilities for
future generations, striving for excellence in science and research, promoting
intercultural dialogue for knowledge exchange, and setting new educational
standards in Azerbaijan.The university collaborates with over 120 partner
universities worldwide and welcomes students from more than 40 countries.

Academic and Research Excellence

BSU actively participates in international exchange
programs such as Erasmus+ KA 107 and Mevlana, facilitating the exchange of
students and staff. The university offers over 12 double degree programs with
institutions from the USA, Germany, France, Israel, Switzerland, and
Kazakhstan. Notably, the UNESCO Chair on Human Rights and Information Law was
established at BSU in 2015, followed by the ICESCO Chair on Biomedical
Materials.

Membership:

Network of Universities from the Capitals of Europe (UNICA)

BSU also hosts five international centers or
institutes, as the Confucius Institute, Baku King Sejong Institute, Korean
Information Technology Centre, and Kazakh Centre.

Research and Innovation

The university boaststwo research institutes, alongside the
Excellence Centre.Additionally, BSU hastwo education internship and recreational centers and a branchin the regions.The Lyceum and the Collegealso fall under BSU's
supervision.

Accreditation and Rankings

In June 2023,BSU received institutional accreditation
for five years from the Ministry of Science and Education of the Republic of
Azerbaijan. The Independent Agency for Quality Assurance in Education (IQAA)
accredited six of BSU's graduate programs in various chemistry disciplines,
with these international program accreditations being officially recognized for
state accreditation.

The university is also ranked by several other
prestigious ranking organizations, including:

QS:In the "QS World University Rankings 2025," BSU
climbed304 positions, placing in the 688 range and securing the top spot
in Azerbaijan.In theQS Europe Rankings 2025, BSU rose 78 places, reaching 336th and strengthening its regional influence.   In the QS Western Asia Rankings 2025, BSU improved from 19th to 15th, solidifying its position in the     region  .   In theQS Sustainability Rankings2025, BSU leapt 350 places
into the 941-950 range, becoming the only Azerbaijani university in the
top-1000 for  sustainability .   BSU ranked in the 151-175 range for Oil and Gas Engineering and 501-600 range for Mathematics  in theQS Subject Rankingsfor the first time, achieving its highest subject-specific ranking to date.

THE:BSUrepresents Azerbaijan in the THE World University Rankings and  is the only university ranked by "THE Subject Rankings" for physical and engineering sciences.  BSU's position improved by 27 places in Physical Sciences and 55 places in Engineering Sciences.   In theTHE Impact Rankings2024, BSU moved up by 175 places.   For the first time, BSU participated in theTHE Interdisciplinary Science Ranking2024, ranking in the 201-250 range—the highest among Azerbaijani universities.

Greenmetrics: BSU made its debut in theGreenMetric 2024rankings, securing 607th place, a testament to its commitment to environmental sustainability.

Round University Ranking:BSU entered the global top-1000 in theRUR 2024 at 825.

QS Star: BSUevaluated with 5 star (excellent) after QS Star Audit Assessment.

name: National Research Tomsk Polytechnic University
description: We were the first engineering school in Russia’s Siberia and the Far East to open its doors in 1896. Today we are one of Russia’s leading public research universities with a focus on applied science and technology. We are a research university with a strong tradition of excellence in physics, applied engineering, and electronics. Recently, we added nanotechnologies and alternative energy to our research portfolio. TPU’s annual research budget of $30 million ranks second among technical and engineering schools in the country. Roughly ten per cent of funding comes from outside Russia; we rank second to none in this category. 2 bln Rub is the amount of R&D (2nd among Russian universities), 112 mln(rub) Income from International Contracts (1st among Russian universities), and 1 bln(rub) Amount of R&D for Industrial Partners (3rd among Russian universities).We are the only academic institution beyond the Urals operating a nuclear reactor on campus for educational purposes. Our nuclear facility has been operational since 1967 and has been playing a major role in our research effort.Our school offers a wide variety of programs, and we have about 9,000 students enrolled. However, our strengths in teaching go well beyond numbers. We maintain a placement system that connects graduates with prospective employers. As a result, 95 percent of our graduates had job offers at graduation.We offer a number of double degree programs through partnership agreements with schools in Germany, France, the United Kingdom, Czech Republic, and Kazakhstan. About 3,000 international students are enrolled in our programs, making Tomsk Polytechnic a truly multicultural institution. A number of multinationals — Microsoft, Danfoss, Lapp Group, SolidWorks — operate research units on our campus.

name: Université Côte d'Azur
description:
Université Côte d'Azuris a large public scientific, cultural, and professional institution   which brings together 18 of the Côte d’Azur’s leading academic players around a historical university core.   Its fundamental missions are the higher education of students and professionals,excellence in research, and innovation for the benefit of all.

Since January 1, 2020, we have strived to build a 21st century French university based on new interactions between disciplines (multidisciplinarityandtransdisciplinarity) and driven by dynamic collaborations that connect Education-Research-Innovation, as well as strong local, national, and international partnerships with the public and private sectors.

Among the top   9 research-intensive universities in France, with a strong international reputation,     Université Côte d'Azur is committed to transformation and excellence, which it has achieved thanks to theInitiative of Excellence(IdEx)that was awarded in 2016 and made permanent in 2021, placing it among the top 9 research-intensive universities in France, witha strong international reputation. Home   to    the   IA-Cluster «3IA Côte d’Azur 2030",   Université Côte d’Azur also created the French School of AI (EFELIA Côte d'Azur)      in 2022,     and establishedGraduate Schools(EUR). The university aims to be a major research-intensive university with both strong roots in our region and an international and European outlook, notably through theEuropean University "Ulysseus"of which Université Côte d’Azur is a founding member.

Université Côte d'Azur hasseveral campuses, mainly in Nice, Sophia Antipolis and Cannes but also widely distributed between Seyne-sur-Mer and Menton. Ideally located between the sea and the mountains, it offers a pleasant environment for its staff and students. Its location in the heart of Europe combined with easy access via theNice Côte d'Azur International Airportmakes it a gateway to the academic and scientific world.

Université Côte d'Azur directly employs more than 3,000 staff and enrolls more than 30,000 students each year.

Master of science: a high-quality,   international   and interdisciplinary offer

Aiming to prepare young generations for the professions of the future and provide solutions for the challenges we face, in 2018 Université Côte d’Azur developed a series ofinternational MSc programs, of which there are now 11.These programs of excellence are fully taught in English and involve the participation of leading academics and practitioners. They are built around regional   objectives   and prestigious international partnerships. These   nationally-accredited   MSc degree courses welcome students from around the world (more than 110 countries), a multiculturalism that is one of our strengths.

But high quality is only one of our criteria, in addition we have built our programs around values that reflect who we are.

More information about our MSc degree courses is availablehere.

name: Eastern Mediterranean University
description: Established in 1979 in Northern Cyprus as a state university, Eastern Mediterranean University offers programs mainly in English, fully recognized by the  Council of Higher Education in Turkey, on a campus stretching over an area of 1,7000,000 m². The University owns unprecedented campus facilities and has created a multicultural environment with nearly 20,000 students from 108 countries and prominent faculty members from 34 different nations. Thanks to the modern understanding of education shared by all, students are brought up as creative and confident individuals who are thoroughly equipped with excellent research skills. The administration of Eastern Mediterranean University spent considerable time developing protocols for international collaboration and exchange programs and was able to settle agreements with about 190 institutions of higher education throughout the world. A considerable number of programs have gained the accreditation of reputable international accreditation bodies such as ABET, EQUINE (EURO-INF), TEDQUAL, FIBAA, AQAS, PCN, NAAB, EPDAD, MIAK, TPD, SABAK and ASIIN. EMU is also a full member of various prominent international organizations such as  CMU, EUA, IAU, EUA-CDE, UK ENIC, ACSA, EAAE, IFI, AMS, AACSB, ECPR, PRME, EUPRERA, ICO-D, ADEE, TESOL, IATEFL, EMT, ESTIEM, WWDSIE, ELFA, WACS, WDOMS, FIP, IPSF, IAMCR, IPB, AMFORT, HOSCO, ICC, ILTA, Cumulus, COHEHRE  and EPSA. As an international university with 12 faculties and 5 schools, EMU is proud to have produced more than 70,000 graduates from different cultures and countries.

name: Universidade Federal do Rio Grande Do Sul
Universität Regensburg
description:
The University of Regensburg, founded in 1962, is located on a modern campusat the southern edge of a historic city dating back to the Roman Ages. In 2006the city has been inscribed in the world heritage list due to its unique andwell preserved old town. Besides the beauty of Regensburg the fact that theUniversity of Regensburg is a campus university is a great advantage to otherinstitutions in Germany. The campus offers everything you need for youreveryday life from restaurants to a hairdresser and even a supermarket.

Butmost important the university provides a broad variety of disciplines, afavourable student-teacher ratio and excellent facilities. Originally designedas a regional university, it has developed into a renowned center of teachingand research with a strong tradition in international cooperation. There arecurrently around 21,000 students enrolled at University of Regensburg, including1,700 international students (as of winter semester 2016/17). Furthermore, theUniversity of Regensburg is committed to the academic freedom in research andteaching. The university sees itself as a community supporting the equality ofwomen and men. Research is the university’s principal duty and its foundationfor expert teaching. The university fosters the development of professionalskills and is dedicated to turn its students into motivated and criticalindividuals.

To improve the knowledge and technology transfer between university research and private business the University of Regensburg created a multidisciplinary service facility called FUTUR. It acts as intermediary, interpreter and promoter between the university and industry in the field of knowledge and technology transfer - for the benefit of both partners. The primary objectives of knowledge and technology transfer are, on the one hand, to disseminate the potentials of knowledge and innovation to companies and, on the other hand, to acquire practical experience and obtain external funding for the university.  FUTUR began its work in promoting regional economic development in February 1989. Over 820 contacts, consultations and co-operations have been established over the past 14 years. About 1300 consultations with representatives of private enterprises, 1266 consultations with members of the University of Regensburg and 756 consultations with members of other universities have since taken place.

name: Vellore Institute of Technology (VIT), Vellore, India
description:
Vellore Institute of Technology (VIT) is one of the premier institutions of India founded in 1984 by Dr. G. Viswanathan, the Chancellor of the University. Dr G Viswanathan became the first Asian to be Honoured with a PhD degree by the West Virginia University, USA in 2009 for his significant contributions to higher education of India and societal development. Government of India has recognized VIT as one of the Institutions of Eminence (IoE) of India.

The institution has developed a student-centred success culture and offers the highest importance to ensuring consistently high quality learning, teaching and research experiences. This is making the students ready for industry and attracting reputed companies to recruit them. VIT has established a right culture of diversity and inclusivity in the campus; it welcomes unconventional thoughts, cross fertilization of ideas, autonomy, multidisciplinary, interdisciplinary and transdisciplinary approaches. It offers a range of world class extracurricular facilities and support to students where they feel that it is their own campus for learning. VIT has strong alumni network worldwide and international linkages which are helping the students and faculty members to establish global contacts for collaborations.

VIT has been constantly ranked among the best Universities and is aspiring to emerge as a global leader. VIT has already been ranked by the major International rankings agencies such as Shanghai ARWU Ranking, QS, Times Higher Education, US News, RUR and others. VIT sets the record, as Seven of the subjects made way to the prestigious Quacquarelli Symonds (QS) World University Rankings (WUR) by Subject in 2021. Seven subjects of VIT are within the top 450 QS World University Rankings by Subject.

VIT has national accreditation from National Assessment and Accreditation Council (NAAC), Govt. of India with A++ grade.

VIT has published the highest number of research publications in India in 2016, 2017, 2018, 2019, 2020 as per Elsevier (Scopus) database. There is a significant growth of h index since the year 2015. VIT has established some of the state of art laboratories in collaboration with industries and Govt. of India. VIT has ten research centres in futuristic areas and has 300+ global academic partnerships in operation.

name: Symbiosis International (Deemed University)
description:
Symbiosis International (Deemed University):A Global Hub of Education and Innovation

Symbiosis International (Deemed University) (SIU)emerged from the visionary mind of Prof. (Dr.) S. B. Mujumdar, a renowned botanist, in 1971. Initially conceived as a haven for foreign students studying in India, Symbiosis has grown into a multifaceted institution rooted in the Vedic principle of "Vasudhaiva Kutumbakam" – the world is one family. This philosophy resonates deeply with the university's mission of fostering international understanding through quality education.

The university's mission, deeply rooted in its core values, extends beyond academic excellence. SIU strives to inculcate the spirit of "Vasudhaiva Kutumbakam," contribute to knowledge generation and dissemination, promote ethical and value-based learning, and foster national development. Cross-cultural sensitization, the development of global competencies, nurturing creativity, encouraging entrepreneurship, enhancing employability, and promoting health and wellness are integral aspects of SIU's educational philosophy. Furthermore, the university instills sensitivity towards the community and environment, aiming to produce thought-provoking leaders for society.

The university has institutes spread across four Indian states (Karnataka, Uttar Pradesh, Telangana, and Maharashtra) and aninternational off-shore campusin Dubai, UAE. This vast network underscores SIU's commitment to providing accessible and high-quality education to a diverse student body.

SIU's academic portfolio spans eight disciplines: Law, Management, Computer Studies, Medical & Health Sciences, Media & Communication, Humanities & Social Sciences, Engineering, Architecture & Design offering undergraduate, postgraduate, and doctoral programs. This multidisciplinary approach equips students with the knowledge and skills necessary to thrive in a rapidly evolving global landscape.

Attracting students from all Indian states and over 85 countries, SIU fosters a vibrant and diverse learning environment. The university's highly qualified and dedicated faculty are committed to transforming students into responsible global citizens. This commitment is reflected in SIU's consistently high placement rates, approaching nearly 100%, making it a preferred destination for learners from across the globe.

SIU's commitment to excellence is further validated by its impressive national and international rankings. It has been ranked 31st in India by the National Institutional Ranking Framework (NIRF) 2024. Internationally, SIU has made significant strides, securing positions in the 601–800 band globally and 4th in India in the Times Higher Education (THE) World University Rankings 2025. In the QS World University Rankings 2025, SIU is ranked 31st globally and 1st in India for Employer Reputation. The University is also ranked 216 in Asia, 42nd in Southern Asia, and 23rd in India in the recently published QS World University Rankings (Asia) 2025. The university's performance in specific fields, such as Business & Management Studies and Social Sciences & Management, further underscores its academic prowess.

Beyond academics, SIU has garnered numerous accolades, including recognition as a 2000-Watt Smart City and the Asia Pacific Quality Label (APQL). Its membership in the Global University Network for Innovation (GUNi) highlights its commitment to global academic collaboration.

SIU's research credentials are robust, with numerous Ph.D. students, publications, patents, and R&D projects funded by government and non-government organizations. TheSymbiosis Centre for Research and Innovation (SCRI)spearheads research initiatives, fostering a vibrant research culture through well-equipped laboratories and research centers in fields like applied artificial intelligence, medical imaging, behavioral science, stem cell research, urban studies, climate change and sustainability, waste management, and nanotechnology. International collaborations further enhance SIU's research capabilities.

To foster entrepreneurship and innovation, SIU has established the Symbiosis Centre of Entrepreneurship and Innovation (SCEI), funded by the Department of Science & Technology, Government of India. The university also promotes women's entrepreneurship through a collaboration with NITI Aayog.

Internationalization is at the heart of SIU's ethos. The Symbiosis Centre for International Education (SCIE) facilitates international programs and manages centers like the Symbiosis Centre for India Australia Studies (SCIAS), Symbiosis Centre for European Studies (SCES), and the Symbiosis Centre for Higher Education Research and Policy Advocacy (SCHERPA). The Centre for Engagement with Africa (SCEA) focuses on capacity building through scholarships and initiatives.

SIU's commitment to social responsibility is evident in its Symbiosis Community Outreach Programme and Extension (SCOPE) Centre. SCOPE has adopted 35 villages, providing healthcare, sanitation, waste resource management, finance & banking, digital literacy, legal counselling, and scholarships. Family Doctor Clinics, Mobile Medical Units, and Mobile Digital Literacy Vans cater to these communities. As a Health Promoting University, SIU has established theSymbiosis Medical College for Women (SMCW), theSymbiosis University and Hospital Research Centre (SUHRC), and centers like the Symbiosis Centre for Emotional Wellbeing (SCEW).

In addition to its academic and social contributions, SIU houses the Dr. Ambedkar Museum and Memorial, preserving the legacy of the architect of the Indian Constitution, and the Afro-Asian Cultural Museum, celebrating cultural diversity.

Symbiosis International (Deemed University) has evolved into a global hub of education and innovation, embodying the principles of international understanding, quality education, and social responsibility. With its diverse programs, world-class faculty, and unwavering commitment to research and community engagement, SIU continues to shape the lives of students and contribute to the betterment of society.

Find out moreabout Symbiosis International (Deemed University) via its social media channels:Facebook,Instagram,YouTube,TwitterandLinkedIn.

name: TUHH Hamburg University of Technology
description: The TUHH is a young and dynamic technical university with around 100 professors and 7,800 students. It is anchored in excellent basic and applied research and thus radiates into the Hamburg metropolitan region and beyond.The TUHH is a competitive, family-oriented and sustainable university with high performance and quality standards that strives for research excellence in basic research and its fields of competence. It is an internationally oriented university in the Hamburg metropolitan region, committed to the Humboldtian ideal of education. It contributes to the development of the technical-scientific competence of society by educating the next generation of engineers with modern teaching and learning methods and by promoting technology transfer and the establishment of companies.The founding principles of the TUHH are unique in Germany: research priority, interdisciplinarity, innovation, regionality as well as internationality are obligatory foundations for our actions. The guiding principle of research, teaching and technology transfer is to develop technology for humanity with the strategic mission for „Engineering to Face Climate Change“.RESEARCHBased on the realisation that innovations and new approaches to solutions often emerge at the boundary between disciplines, the research structure of TUHH is designed to promote interdisciplinary cooperation among scientists. For this reason, the structure is not dictated by faculties or departments, but instead research is organised into five research fields. The research fields address important scientific, social and particularly relevant topics for Hamburg.Advanced Materials & (Bio-)ProcessesAviation & Maritime TechnologiesCyber Physical & Medical SystemsEnvironmental & Energy SystemsLogistics, Mobility & InfrastructureThe TUHH sees itself as an engine of innovation. It actively promotes dialogue between companies and scientists, especially in the Hamburg metropolitan region. Knowledge transfer to industry, business and civil society are important elements in TUHH's actions, as is the support of start-ups.STUDY & TEACHINGThe aim of teaching at Hamburg University of Technology is to best prepare engineers for their future career tasks: practically, research- and fundamentally oriented. The study programs benefit from many years of experience with the Bachelor’s and Master’s system.Bachelor’s programs16 study programsStudy qualification: General higher education diploma (Abitur)Degree: Bachelor of ScienceMaster’s programs30 study programsStudy qualifications: General higher education diploma (Abitur) and Bachelor of ScienceDegree: Master of ScienceInnovative Study OrganisationNew teaching methods in small groupsQuality improvement and assurance by the Center for Teaching and Learning (ZLL)Problem-based Learning (PBL)The study programs are provided by six schools and one areas of study:Civil EngineeringElectrical Engineering, Computer Science and MathematicsMechanical EngineeringManagement Sciences and TechnologyProcess and Chemical EngineeringTechnology and Innovation in EducationMultidisciplinary Engineering Science and Technology

name: Ankara Üniversitesi
description: Founded in 1946 in the Turkish capital Ankara, Ankara University was the first higher education institution to be found in the Turkish Republic. A public institution, Ankara University now has a large enrollment (almost 70,000 students) in its 17 faculties. It’s currently ranked within the top 450 universities in the world for medicine and is placed 701+ in the QS World University Rankings. As well as offering affordable accommodation for both Turkish and international students, Ankara University hosts over 180 student clubs and has a wide range of sports facilities. The university also offers 16 undergraduate and 18 graduate programs taught in English.

name: Beijing University of Chemical Technology
description: Founded in 1958 and formerly known as Beijing Institute of Chemical Technology, Beijing University of Chemical Technology has become a nationally recognized multidisciplinary university directly under the Ministry of Education. In the last decade alone, BUCT has made considerable strides in the core fields of science and technology as well as integrating the academic disciplines of management, economics, law, the liberal arts, education and medicine to its curriculum and comprehensive outlook. Now, BUCT has its roots firmly planted on the national stage, becoming a key contributor in both the national ‘211 Project’ and the ‘985 Advantage Subject Innovation Platform,’ while keeping to the original goal of pursuing advanced scientific research and the development of high technology. With its mission to become internationally well-renown, BUCT continues to carve its own unique reputation as a university dedicated to cutting-edge innovativeness and the cultivation of students of all disciplines within an ever changing global environment. BUCT has 2,275 staff and faculty members, including 700 faculty members with the title of professor or associate professor, including six academicians of the Chinese Academy of Sciences and the Chinese Academy of Engineering.

name: Kazakh National Agrarian Research University (KazNARU)
description:
Kazakh National Agrarian
Research University (KazNARU) is the first agricultural institution of the
Republic of Kazakhstan. Today, KazNARU is presented excellence of teaching and
research, international cooperation and the active promotion of young
scientists.

KazNARU is located in a
picturesque area of Almaty at the foot of the Trans Ili Alatau mountains.

KazNARU regularly ranks
among the best universities of Kazakhstan - according to the results of
national ratings, the university is in the top ten universities in the country.
Moreover, in 2022 the university is among the 500 best universities in the
world according to QS World University Ranking.

KazNARU offers 100
educational programs is developed by academic staff of the University and
successfully implemented for bachelors, masters and doctorate students in the
following fields of knowledge: Agriculture and Forestry, Veterinary, Social
Sciences, Engineering and IT, Biotechnology, Food Science.   2 undergraduate and 2 postgraduate
programs  are accredited by German agency ACQUIN.

KazNARU is a member of
Erasmus+ program, Iseki-Food, EENTER, GCHERA, UNAI, ICA, CASCADE, Eurasia-Pacific
Uninet, Visegrad, Silk-Road SUN (Korea), Silk-Road China, IREG. The University
signed agreements on collaboration with more than 140 HEIs and
scientific-research institutions. Our students have an opportunity to study in
Germany, Poland, Czech Republic, Malaysia, Indonesia, Uzbekistan, China, USA,
Hungary, Turkey, UAE and others countries.

KazNARU has a good
infrastructure for innovative research. 
Annually the results of these research works are published in over 200
articles in scientific journals included in Web of Science and Scopus
databases.

The university is a
participant in such programs as DAAD, MASHAV, GIZ, UNICEN, MEVLANA, USAID,
FULBRIGHT, Bolashak, UNDP, FAO, DBU, American Councils.

name: Universidad de Alcalá (Madrid)
description: The University of Alcalá (UAH) is a public university located in Alcalá de Henares, Madrid, a UNESCO world heritage site and one of the longest standing European universities (dating back to 1293). In 1499, Cardinal Cisneros expanded the institution’s studies with the creation of a Higher College, which would later become the University of Alcalá, one of the first examples of a model university town. Today the University of Alcalá is a modern institution, founded in 1977, which preserves its traditional humanities faculties, a testimony to the university's efforts to promote and diffuse the Spanish language through both its studies and the Cervantes Prize, which is awarded annually by the King and Queen of Spain in the Paraninfo (Great Hall).It offers 36 degrees, 46 official masters and 26 PhD programs in five branches of knowledge: Arts and Humanities, Law and Social Sciences, Sciences, Health Sciences, and Engineering and Architecture, adapted to the EHEA. The UAH is firmly committed to research, technological innovation, and collaboration with business and industry, and also to defense of transparency, human rights and sustainability and environmental protection (1st Spanish university, according to GreenMetric, and 3rd in the world, according to Coolmyplanet).

name: University of Klagenfurt
description:
The University of Klagenfurt is a young and vibrant  university in the very south of Austria. Situated at the intersection of the Alpine and Mediterranean cultures, it benefits greatly from its geographical location. Founded in 1970, the University of Klagenfurt has established itself as a leading academic educational institution and a hub for the acquisition, exchange, and transfer of knowledge across the entire Alps-Adriatic Region.

More than 12,000 students pursue their studies and research on the campus, while around 20 percent are international, representing 100 countries between them. The University of Klagenfurt offers a broad choice of Bachelor’s, Master’s, and doctoral degree programmes in the field of engineering, management and economics, social sciences, culture, and languages. Located in Klagenfurt, a beautiful and picturesque Renaissance town, the University of Klagenfurt is one of just a few campus universities in Austria. The proximity to beautiful Lake Wörthersee makes it the most attractive.

Klagenfurt, with its population of about 100,000, is a buzzy and young city in the very center of Europe, located only 2 hours from the Adriatic Sea. It has many shops, museums and restaurants, lidos, hiking trails, and historic attractions.Its library dates back to the sixteenth century and is by far the largest in Carinthia. It is home to around 1 million books, 50,000 e-books, 14,000 e-journals, and more than 50 licensed databases. As the university’s knowledge center, it is open 24 hours, 7 days per week. Precious historical collections are stored in its archives: the Karl Popper collection, the Joseph Buttinger library, the Goess library, and the Hermann Broch library. The special collections include 30,000 old prints, 700 early prints, 271 incunables, 374 paper manuscripts, and 66 parchment manuscripts.

As a modern, research-driven university, Klagenfurt has numerous strengths but cites particular prowess in Information and Communication Technologies. It focuses on all aspects of ”Humans in the Digital Age“, with a brand new Digital Age Research Center currently being established. The ”Karl Popper Kolleg“ provides promising young researchers at the cutting edge of their fields a forum for long-term synergies.

name: University of Missouri, Columbia
description:
Founded in 1839 as the first public university west of the Mississippi River, the University of Missouri (Mizzou) is a committed flagship and land-grant institution, a member of the competitive Southeastern Conference (SEC) — and a proud member of the Association of American Universities (AAU). Our mission is to provide the benefits of a world-class research university to the people of Missouri through teaching, research, service and economic development on behalf of all its citizens.

With an enrollment of over 30,000 students from all 50 states and 100+ countries and an alumni network of over 340,000, Mizzou is a $5 billion global enterprise, with areas of strength including journalism, agriculture and plant science, human and animal health, sustainable energy and more.

A pioneer of experiential learning and the famed Missouri Method, Mizzou is a place where hands-on learning leads to academic excellence, scientific discovery and unparalleled student success.

Visit missouri.edu to learn more.

name: Kasetsart University
description: Kasetsart University is a university known internationally for academic excellence and work of world standard. It is a prime mover in mustering intellectual resources to help the nation achieve sustainable development and negotiating power in the world community. Kasetsart University gathers wisdom and knowledge, creates and develops varied bodies of knowledge, and forms people who are intelligent, who think rationally, who behave morally, who are conscious of the common good, and who produce high standard work capable of competing in the world market. The university manages its resources efficiently, joins in the development of the community, and is responsible to society so as to serve as an important instrument in ensuring the well being and security of the country. Kasetsart University devote itself to the task of accumulating and developing intellectual knowledge. It thrives for the growth in academic wisdom including ethical and moral excellence. In addition, it has a responsibility to play a leading role in keeping our Thai heritage alive and to ensure that it continues to grow to enrich the civilization of the notion.

name: Lingnan University, Hong Kong
description:
Founded in Guangzhou in 1888 and known as Lingnan Xuexiao,Lingnan Universityhas been a distinguished part of Hong Kong's academic
landscape for over a century. After flourishing in the field of higher
education until 1952, it was reborn in Hong Kong in 1967. Today, Lingnan
aspires to be a distinguished research-focused quality education university in
the digital age, embracing a heritage that combines a commitment to excellence
in teaching, learning, and research with a dedication to fostering community
ties and striving for international acclaim.

Lingnan University stands as a global leader in Quality
Education and Impactful Research, dedicated to nurturing well-rounded,
informed, and socially responsible individuals. Our commitment is actualized
through a comprehensive curriculum that integrates pioneering research and a
broadened focus on quality education. We ensure that every aspect of the
university experience, from vibrant campus life and diverse extra-curricular
activities to proactive community service, extensive workplace experience, and
global learning opportunities, contributes to the personal and intellectual
growth of our students.

Our academic offerings, which include undergraduate, taught
postgraduate, and research postgraduate programmes, are delivered by the
Faculties of Arts, Business, Social Sciences, the School of Graduate Studies,
and the School of Interdisciplinary Studies. These programmes empower students
to navigate and succeed in a rapidly transforming social, cultural, and
economic landscape.

Lingnan's commitment to quality education has been recognized
with the highest score among the eight UGC-funded universities for
"undergraduate satisfaction with the quality and value gained from their
teaching and learning experience," as noted in the University Grants
Committee’s University Accountability Agreements annual progress report for two
consecutive years. Additionally, Lingnan achieved the second-best score in
"undergraduate satisfaction with their overall learning environment"
based on student evaluations.

The university's innovative drive extends to the Lingnan
Entrepreneurship Initiative (LEI), which serves as a hub for innovation and
entrepreneurship (I&E) activities, supporting the Lingnan community to
address humanitarian challenges with sustainable development and
entrepreneurial spirit.

In the realm of research and societal impact, Lingnan has
excelled in developing innovation and technology research that drives positive
societal and global impact. Success is evident not only in our knowledge
transfer projects but also in the establishment of new platforms and the
identification of opportunities. We have established several joint research
centres in the Greater Bay Area, leveraging our integration with the Northern
Metropolis. These centres focus on e-business and logistics, financial inclusion
and digital economy, social governance, and ageing in place, fostering
collaborative efforts that extend our reach and impact.

As a caring liberal arts university, Lingnan University is
also deeply committed to the Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs) set by the
United Nations. This commitment is reflected in our research, academic
programmes, teaching and learning, knowledge transfer, social engagement
projects, entrepreneurship initiatives, and corporate governance, all aimed at
bettering humankind.

name: Nanjing University of Science and Technology
description: Nanjing University of Science and Technology was founded in 1953 and its main campus is located in Nanjing, Jiangsu Province, China. The university is focused on getting the tech community to work together and in contact with the students. Nanjing University offers both undergraduate and postgraduate and is home to 13 schools.

name: Universidad Panamericana (UP)
description:
Universidad Panamericanawas founded in 1967 as a business school. The original group of scholars and business people who founded the Pan-American Institute of Top Business Management (IPADE), soon began promoting what is today Universidad Panamericana.

Our institution offersa wide variety of undergraduate and posgraduate programsacross4 campuses12 different schools:

We are also proud to beranked #1 both in Mexico and Latin America in  Philosophy  and  Hospitality Leisure Management  subjectsby the QS World University Rankings by Subject
