We also teach 11 classical and constructed languages, Latin, Ancient Greek, Old English, Sanskrit, Syriac Aramaic, Pahlavi, Classical Nahuatl, Akkadian, Sumerian, Classical Hebrew and Esperanto.

RESEARCH EXCELLENCE

With a mission to “introduce the rest of the world to China” and “present China globally”, SISU has won an unparalleled reputation in China’s linguistics and international studies, playing an active role in the country's diplomatic decision-making. Our research excellence has been further recognized for our progress in political science, by developing a focused research field in Area Studies.

We operate more than 100 research institutes and centers serving as academic think tanks to provide advisory services on language policies, diplomatic strategies and global public opinion of China. These academic entities have contributed landmark research and are also dedicated to promoting the development of social sciences in China.

GLOBAL PRESENCE

We have now established partnerships with more than 430 universities and institutions from 62 countries and regions, and have maintained close connection with international organizations, including the United Nations and the European Union.

We have also compiled and published a series of Mandarin Chinese textbooks to be used by non-Chinese speakers as a means of further promoting cultural exchange between China and the rest of the world. Over the past five years, around 4,000 international students have been enrolled each year in our Chinese language programs or other degree schemes and 10 Confucius Institutes have been established in Asia, Africa, Europe, North and South America.

CORE VALUES

SISU has launched the “Multilingual+” Initiative, a pioneering educational reform strategy towards global studies to meet with the future “multilingual+” era. “Multilingual” means that our students should at least master two second languages, and owns brilliant intercultural communication abilities. “+” (Plus) refers to interdisciplinary education that “interconnects” different fields of disciplines and subjects with area studies as its core.

name: Shanghai University of Finance and Economics
Shiv Nadar Institution of Eminence
description: Shiv Nadar University is a comprehensive, multidisciplinary, research-focused, and student-centric University offering a full range of academic programs at the undergraduate, postgraduate and doctoral level. With state-of-the-art infrastructure, the University comprises of academic wings, sophisticated labs, international standard sports facilities, amphitheaters, auditorium, conference rooms and smart classrooms. The University’s goal is to become internationally recognized for the quality of its research and creative endeavors and their applicability to improving quality of life, generating new insights and expanding the boundaries of human knowledge creativity. Committed to excellence in teaching, research and service, the University aims to serve the higher education needs of India and the world beyond.

name: Siksha ‘O’ Anusandhan (Deemed to be University), SOA
description:
Siksha ‘O’ Anusandhan (SOA), located in the city of Bhubaneswar, Odisha, India is presently one amongst the leading higher education institutions in the country. It is a Deemed to be University declared under Section 3 of the University Grants Commission Act., 1956, India.It is actively engaged in education and research in Engineering & Technology, Medical & Dental Sciences, Pharmaceutical Sciences, Biotechnology, Management Sciences, Nursing, Hospitality & Tourism Management, Legal Studies, Agricultural Sciences, Basic Sciences & Humanities at Undergraduate, Post-Graduate, Post-Masters' in Medical Sciences, Doctoral and Post-Doctoral level. All the programmes have been approved and recognized by respective statutory councils of India.

For maintaining consistent high academic standards:•    SOA has been granted with Category-II Graded Autonomy Status by University Grants Commission, India•    It has been reaccredited with ‘A’ Grade by NAAC with a score of 3.35 out of 4.00.•    SOA has been consistently ranked within Top 25 on National level for 2016, 2017, 2018, 2019, 2020 & 2021 by National Institutional Ranking Framework (NIRF), Govt. of India•    SOA is the fourth Institute in India to get three of its engineering programmes accredited by Accreditation Board for Engineering and Technology (ABET), USA for six years in its first attempt.

SOA presently offers a rich portfolio of more than 111 academic programs in disciplines that ranges from technology, to medicine, nursing, dental, law and agriculture. The university is home to highly focused and relevant research across 16 R&D Centres and 58 best in class research labs in 22 research thrust areas aligned with national and international priorities such as Nano science and Nano technology, Bio materials and tissue regeneration, Renewable Energy, etc. Despite being just over a decade old, SOA generated 8463 SCOPUS Indexed Publications with a h-index of 77 and 4825 Web of Science Indexed Publications with a h-index of 71 . Its SCOPUS indexed publications, which increased by around 65 times, is a testimony to its enabling environment for undertaking research. SOA has filed 317 Patents and 9 nos. of Designs out of which 21 patents and 9 designs has been granted.

The academic and research pursuits of SOA is supported by the presence of quality talent onboard. Quality Faculty and students are at the core of Institute’s growth. SOA puts considerable emphasis on internationalization and has distinguished international faculty on board from reputed universities such as UC Davis, University of Oklahoma, Penn State University, Arizona State University etc. It has international collaborations with leading universities globally such as UC Davis, USA, Aarhus University, Denmark, Florida International University, USA; University of Texas, Arlington, USA; Dongseo University, Korea; Ho-Chi-Minh City University of Transport, Vietnam; Rajamangala University of Technology, Thailand, Aarhus University, Denmark etc.

SOA also focused on holistic development of community at large. The contribution which it gives back to the region and country in particular is tremendous and unparalleled. It offers free outdoor medical facilities and 1500 free beds through SUM Hospital, benefitting ~15 lakh people. SOA operates 1 urban and 1 rural health centre with 5,000+ health camps benefitting ~5 lakh people in total. During COVID pandemic SOA established 10 dedicated COVID Hospitals and 2
 COVID Care Centres comprising of 2400 beds (both General & Intensive Care), that treated thousand 
patients free of cost in collaboration of Govt. of Odisha.

name: Slovak University of Agriculture in Nitra
description:
Slovak University of Agriculture in Nitra has attained the position of one of Slovakia’s leading universities in the period since it was founded in 1952. The University is consistently rated in the top group for the high quality of its teaching and research in the Slovak Republic. The University cultivates close and productive links with its local and regional community and will continue to expand its work at an international level in both teaching and scientific research. We have a strong tradition of working in collaboration with business and industry and playing an active role in economic regeneration. Finally, we recognise that our future success and direction will be dependent upon how we embrace and respond to new information and communication technologies.

The university provides education in the field of agriculture and related research areas such as: Agro biology, Food resources, sustainable agriculture, Agricultural production, biotechnology, food technology, Engineering of agricultural machinery and equipment, Computerization and automation of agricultural equipment, Operation of energy facilities on agricultural production, Gardening and landscape design, Economics and Management, International trade in agricultural commodities, Marketing, Development of rural tourism, Project management for rural development, Lifelong learning, etc...

Our mission is:

1. To build an institution widely recognised, at a regional, national and international level, as a world leader in research and teaching.

2. To conduct research across all academic departments which makes a significant contribution to the extension of human knowledge and understanding.

3. Through our teaching and research programmes to equip our graduates with the necessary education and skills to make a significant contribution to the economy and to society as a whole.

4. To recruit students and staff with outstanding potential and to provide the best support and facilities to foster teaching, learning and research of the highest quality.

5. To serve our local and regional communities through the provision of excellent and innovative teaching, research, training, cultural, enterprise and employment opportunities.

6. To exploit opportunities for collaboration and partnership with other higher educational institutions, educational institutions and commercial partners.

7. To strengthen and diversify our activities in the fields of industrial and business liaison, innovation, exploitation and entrepreneurialism, thereby supporting economic growth and regeneration.

8. To continue our tradition of making a high quality and challenging University education available to those who are capable of benefiting from it.

name: Tamkang University
description: Tamkang University (TKU)is ranked by Global Views Monthly as the first in the "University of Humanities and Social Sciences" and ranked third in the "Degree of Internationalization" among the private schools in the"Taiwan's Best University Rankings" in 2022. Some of the many honors received by the university include:

name: Tanta University
description:
At Tanta University, we offer diverse academic programs,
from medical and science to education and the humanities. Our aim is to provide you with a well-rounded education that suits your interests and goals.

Affordable Tuition: We believe in quality education without
the high costs. Our average undergraduate tuition per year makes it an
accessible choice for your academic journey.

Global Exposure: Explore the world with our exchange
programs and summer training. Gain international experience and new skills
while studying with us.

Active Campus Life: Stay active and healthy with sports like
football, basketball, and more. Our sports facilities and expert coaches help
You stay fit and have fun.

Healthcare: Your well-being matters. We have 22 medical
clinics on campus to ensure your health needs are met.

Tanta University is not just about academics; it's a place
to grow and prepare for the future. Join us for quality education and a
fulfilling student experience. Your journey to success begins here.

Students at Tanta University enjoy exchange programs in different specializations in addition to summer training programs. All students have access to the IT Club, the Center of Fine Arts, and the Science Club.

Moreover, all students can receive medical care through the Students’ Health Care Medical Administration of Tanta University, which includes 22 clinics of different specialties.

However, life at Tanta University has many other aspects. Students can practice many activities. The Sports Activity Department offers students opportunities to do a lot of individual and team sports with an elite group of specialized coaches. There are many pitches and courts, such as the Olympic football pitch, track for athletes, hole for long jump, throwing circle for shot put and another one for discus throw, volleyball courts, a basketball court, and tennis courts.

name: Tashkent State Transport University
Technical University of Cluj-Napoca
description: Based in the Romanian city of Cluj-Napoca (Cluj, for short), this technical university is home to nearly 20,000 students, making it the second-largest university in the city. The Technical University of Cluj-Napoca was founded in 1948 and initially had two departments: thermotechnics and machines. The university now has nine faculties in Cluj-Napoca:

name: Tecnológico de Costa Rica -TEC
description:
Tecnológico de Costa Rica (TEC), founded in 1971,  is a public university devoted to higher education, dedicated to teaching, research and extension activities of technology and related sciences for development.

Its official name is from Technological Institute of Costa Rica (ITCR) and it is from 2010, that at the level of communication a change in the image is made and it is called Tecnológico de Costa Rica (TEC), as a promotional name.

In September 2012, the Government of the Republic declares the TEC as "Benemérita Institution of Costa Rican education, culture and science and technology".

The TEC aims to achieve, through teaching, research and service to society, excellence in the comprehensive training of professionals and the incorporation, systematic and continuous, of the technology that requires the development of Costa Rica within its own Action field.

It offers courses that grant degrees corresponding to any of the university degrees, mainly the field of technology. Our university is the first Scientific and Technological Institution of Higher Education in Costa Rica. In our university we have developed important research that has had an impact not only in the society at local level but also at international level.

name: The "Gheorghe Asachi" Technical University of Iasi
The University of Northampton
description:
Located in an ancient market town steeped in the social, political and industrial history of the nation, theUniversity of Northamptonis actually one of the UK’s youngest universities.

Since its establishment, it’s been rapidly building a reputation for its innovative teaching with a long-standing reputation amongst students for supportive, high quality teaching. We use technology to shift our focus onto the development of in-depth understanding and the application of knowledge and skills. This means you will benefit from meaningful interactions with tutors in seminars, tutorials and workshops, rather than being talked at in lecture theatres.

By harnessing novel technologies that inject interest and introduce flexibility into the theoretical practices of learning, the university has made its students able to study and work wherever they want, whenever they want, with whoever they want. As a result, seminars and workshops deliver a deeper, more meaningful relationship with lecturers and professors, more time to explore, challenge and question, whilst leaving space and time for individual support, advice and guidance.

With that, the University of Northampton is proud to offer adiverse range of undergraduate and postgraduate degree programsacross three faculties: Faculty of Business and Law, Faculty of Arts, Science and Technology and Faculty of Health, Education and Society.

Discover more about international student life at the University of Northampton by attending avirtual event, or ask the students themselves on ourAsk a Student page!

name: The University of Notre Dame, Australia
description:
The
University of Notre Dame Australia is a national university, with campuses
across Australia in Sydney, Perth and Broome.

Notre Dame has a strong commitment to
honouring the individual and recognises that each student is graced with their
own gifts and talents. Notre Dame believes that higher education should prepare
students for a rich, fulfilling and reflective life, not just a career path.

Notre Dame has been rated 5 stars in the
Good Universities Guide 2025, undergraduate and postgraduate categories, for
Learner Engagement, Skills Development and Full-Time Employment.

A national Catholic university

A national Catholic university with more
than 11,000 students, our degrees offer practical, career-focused learning
which combines theoretical knowledge and workplace experience, as well as a
strong foundation in ethics, to help ensure students graduate job-ready.

Pastoral care is at the heart of our ethos –
including small class sizes, one-on-one contact with academic staff, mentoring
programs and counselling support. We provide tailored support programs for
international, interstate and regional students. We also focus on providing
students with access to career guidance, practical workplace experience and
direct links to employers.

We welcome people of all faiths or none at
all. As an academic community, we encourage open and rigorous enquiry, debate
and discussion.

Our campuses

Our Fremantle Campus is located in historic
buildings in the beachside city 20 minutes south of Perth, with leafy
courtyards and cafés all forming part of the quintessential university town
experience.

Our Broome Campus, located on the stunning,
tropical north-west coast of Australia, supports important connections with
local Indigenous communities and is home to the Nulungu Research Institute, the
Kimberley Centre for Remote Medical Training (KCRMT) (a Medical School
end-to-end program with students housed on campus), and the Majarlin
Kimberley Centre for Remote Health.

Our Broadway Campus, located in Sydney's
bustling inner-city university precinct, provides a welcoming social hub within
easy walking distance from the city's CBD and Central Station.

At our Darlinghurst Campus, also in Sydney,
Medical and Nursing students learn in excellent facilities, including simulated
wards and consultation suites, just a stone's throw from one of the country's
top medical facilities, St Vincent's Hospital.

Admission and selection

Notre Dame's admission process is
multifaceted and considers every applicant on an individual basis. While each
program has academic entry requirements, the University also considers the
whole person, as we recognise it requires more than academic excellence to
succeed in your chosen profession.

Life at Notre Dame

All Notre Dame students have access to a
range of free services, resources, and tools to support their study and career
objectives.

Notre Dame’s International Student
Experience Team is available to help students succeed in their studies. The
team can help students with academic support, such as English language or
one-on-one assignment support, or suggest fun clubs and events.

There are numerous student clubs and
societies offering opportunities for students to develop socially, culturally,
professionally, spiritually and academically.

Notre Dame’s Student Associations are at
the centre of student life. The Student Associations represent and support all
students and create engagement opportunities that contribute to the
University’s vibrant community.

Student Life supports and enables
participation in a wide variety of sporting, social and cultural pursuits. Students
can get involved in social sporting competitions, club sport or intervarsity
events such as the UniSport Nationals.

Study options

A broad range of degrees are offered across
seven academic schools:

·       
    Arts & Sciences

·       
    Education

·       
    Health Sciences

·       
    Law & Business

·       
    Medicine

·       
    Nursing & Midwifery

·       
    Philosophy & Theology.

Notre Dame offers undergraduate and
postgraduate degrees to international students, including:

·       
    Bachelor’s degrees

·       
    Graduate certificates

·       
    Graduate diplomas

·       
    Master’s degrees by coursework

·       
    Higher degrees by research

·       
    Doctor of Medicine

We also have a range of scholarships
available to domestic and international students across all study types.

Learn more about our campus, scholarships
and study options at notredame.edu.au.
Follow Notre Dame on LinkedIn,
YouTube and TikTok. Follow the Fremantle
Campus on Facebook
and Instagram, and
the Sydney Campus on Facebook
and Instagram.

name: Tishk International University
description:
Tishk International University (TIU),
(previously Ishik University),   is a private   university   established in 2008 in
Erbil-Kurdistan, Iraq and owned by local and International investors and
educators.

Tishk International University is granted   ISO 9001:2015   Certificate for the Quality
Management System and is a member of the Union of Arabic Universities.

The university started educational service
with 5 faculties containing 9 departments on the first campus in Erbil. The
rules and regulations of Tishk International University allow international
students from any country to join any study program within the University. In
the academic year 2015–2016, the number of international students studying at the
University reached 100 students.

The teaching language at Tishk International
University is English, except the law program which is based on the Arabic
language. Also, Tishk International University has adopted the European Credit
Transfer System (ECTS) to assess the achievement of expected learning outcomes.
At TIU the academic year is divided into two main terms: fall and spring. In
addition, the University offers intensive summer schools which allow students
to study a number of courses and cover the required credits.

At
Tishk International University, several programs are awarded International
Accreditation. These are Civil Engineering, Architectural Engineering, Interior
Design, Computer Engineering, Information Technology, accredited by the   “Central Evaluation and
Accreditation Agency” (ZEvA)  ; Physics Education, Biology Education,
Mathematics Education, English Language Teaching accredited by   the “Accreditation Service
for International Schools, Colleges & Universities” (ASIC)   and
Law program accredited   the   Quality Assurance and Accreditation Center of   AArU
(The Association of Arab Universities).     Tishk International University has also been awarded
Institutional Accreditation by ZEvA in January 2021.

In May 2018, TIU was certified to ISO
9001:2015 Quality Management Systems Certificate by Bureau Veritas
Certification Holding SAS-UK Branch. The Certificate was accredited by the
United Kingdom Accreditation Services Body (UKAS).     There is more than 100 international staff working in both academic and
non-academic positions, from a wide range of countries such as Turkey,
Kazakhstan, Turkmenistan, Uzbekistan, Syria, Kenya, Nigeria, India, Yemen,
Russia, Bangladesh, UK and the United States.

2014-2015 Academic Year was a turning point
for the University from many angles:

name: Tokai University
description: Tokai University is a private university established by Dr. Shigeyoshi Matsumae in1942. “Tokai” of “Tokai University” refers to the sea to the east of Asia, namely the Pacific Ocean, and symbolizes the desire to foster rich spirits and broad perspectives. Tokai University consists of 7 campuses in Sapporo, Takanawa, Yoyogi, Shonan, Isehara, Shimizu, and Kumamoto, which are composed of 19 schools and colleges made up of 75 departments, majors, and programs. Its graduate school and professional graduate school offer 32 programs. The total student population is about 30,000. Tokai University maintains academic exchange agreements with more than 125 universities/organizations in 39 countries. A wide range of international exchange activities are being aggressively pursued, from those on the academic front involving students, researchers, joint-research projects, and the exchange of academic resources, to cultural and athletic exchange. There are approx. 1100 international students on campus. Tokai University has six offices abroad (Denmark, Vienna, Hawaii, Korea, Thailand and Vladivostok.)

name: Tokushima University
description: The Tokushima University has five undergraduate Faculties — Integrated Arts and Sciences, Medicine, Dentistry, Pharmaceutical Sciences, and Engineering. The Graduate School comprises the Schools of Integrated Arts and Sciences, Medical Sciences, Oral Sciences, Pharmaceutical Sciences, Nutrition and Bioscience, Health Sciences, and Advanced Technology and Science, as well as three Institutes, Socio-Arts and Sciences, Biomedical Sciences, and Technology and Science. There is also a University Hospital. University Libraries are located on both the Kuramoto and Josanjima Campuses. The university also has 16 joint education and research facilities including the Center for University Extension, the Center for Administration of Information Technology and the International Center on the Josanjima Campus, the International Center and the Institute for Enzyme Research and the Institute for Genome Research on the Kuramoto Campus.

name: Transilvania University of Brasov
description:
Transilvania University of Brasov (UniTBv) is the largest public university in the central region of Romania, with 19.300 students and 760 full-time academic staff. Our students are enjoying the diversity and quality of the study programs (100+ bachelor programmes, 60+ master programmes, 18 PhD programmes), the beauty of Brașov city – a medieval town surrounded by mountains, in the heart of the country – and the vibrant and multicultural campus life.

Our educational offer promotes interdisciplinarity and reflects the comprehensive structure of the university, including undergraduate and postgraduate programmes in engineering, social sciences, humanities, arts, medicine, mathematics and sports. Our focus is on top performance in education, student international mobility, and the richness of students' social and cultural experience in campus.

Research at Transilvania University of Brasov is supported by the state-of-the-art infrastructure of the R&D Institute, one of the largest research platforms recently developed in South-Eastern Europe. Researchers, teaching staff and students work together in 30 research centers and interdisciplinary teams with results which have placed UniTBv among the most prestigious and competitive Romanian public universities.

Transilvania University of Brasov motto "Learn to be in the Center!" is therefore an invitation to self-expression, creativity and leadership in both education and research.

name: Tunghai University
description:
Tunghai University was established in 1955 and is the
first private university in Taiwan .  Located on the level
plateau of Taichung’s Tatu Mountain, it boasts a beautiful campus and
significant archite  ctural landmarks, including the world-famous Luce
Chapel. A leading university with a long tradition in liberal arts education,
Tunghai has 9 colleges, 37 departments and 39  Master’s programs (13 In-Service Master’s
programs) and 14 PhD programs. The 9 colleges are the College of
Arts, College of Science, College of Engineering, College of Management,
College of Social Sciences, College of Agriculture, College of Fine Arts and
Creative Design, College of Law, and the International College. Tunghai
has a student body of approximately 16,000 students and close to 600 teachers .
The total area of the Tunghai campus is 133 hectares. With its spacious campus,
Tunghai has an  ideal teaching and learning
environment for its faculty and students. Tunghai has received 857 million
NTD in funding from the Ministry of Education’s Teaching Excellence
Project, making it one of just seven universities in Taiwan to receive funding
every year since the Teaching Excellence Project was initiated twelve years
ago. In addition, Tunghai graduates rank highly in
recruitment rankings. These outstanding performances
are credible indices of Tunghai’s constant pursuit of excellence in
both teaching and academic development.

name: UCAM Universidad Católica San Antonio de Murcia
description: TheUniversidad Católica San Antonio(UCAM), is a private university located in Murcia, Southeast of Spain.Murcia’s climate, food, rich Spanish culture, and Mediterranean weather are just some of the attractive pulls of the area – and let’s not forget about fiesta, tapas and flamenco.It’s a midsize region (1.5 million inhabitants), offering affordable living costs, a safe environment, and modern infrastructure.The university offers a number of international Bachelor’s and Master’s Degrees, PhD programs and intensive language courses throughout the academic year and summer. The university boasts good graduate employability prospects, and is best known for its multicultural campus, programs offered and its infrastructure.Teaching is usually conducted in Spanish, but we also offer several programs taught completely in English, including Business, Tourism, Sport Sciences and Health Sciences (Bachelors, Masters and PhDs).UCAM also has a Language school that teaches different language programs such as French, German, Korean, Chinese, Portuguese, Italian and sign language.To find out moreabout the university, you can visit its social media accounts:Facebook;Instagram;YouTube;Twitter;LinkedIn.

name: Universidad Autonoma Chapingo
description:
Universidad Autónoma Chapingo, also known as Chapingo Autonomous University, is one of the leading agricultural colleges in Mexico and Latin America with167 experience years. It provides free studies to young people from all the states of the country, giving priority to those who come from indigenous populations. One of the most cultural richeness of the University is the presence of 76% of the indigenous languages ​​ from Mexico.

Recognized in the QS World University Rankings by
Subject 2021 for its agriculture & forestry teaching asthe second best ranked in
México, and in the Global QS World University Rankings as one of theTop 10
Universities and Top 5 Public Universities in the country, the university
offers a range of 27 bachelor, 14 master and 12 PhD's degrees.

Located in Texcoco, Mexico State, the university is also home
to the National Museum of Agriculture, which explores the development of
agriculture in Mexico from the country’s pre-Hispanic origins to the present
day. This museum is a valuable study resource for students at the university.
The university is also famous for its artistic murals, created by the painter
Diego Rivera.

name: Universidad Autónoma de Guadalajara (UAG)
description: The Universidad de Guadalajara (UAG) was founded in 1935 as the first private university in Mexico. The UAG is a coeducational, nondenominational and nonprofit organization. It is independent, autonomous, and is not affiliated with or dependent on any government, church or political party. The University is proud to be thoroughly Mexican and, at the same time, to emphasize its orientation to international education. The UAG has some of the best educational facilities in the country, covering an area of 2,000 acres, distributed in 4 campuses in the zone of Guadalajara city: the Central Campus (C.U.), the Biological Sciences Institute, the Health Sciences Campus, and the University in the Community (UNICO). The UAG also owns other campus in the city of Villahermosa in Southwest Mexico. In addition, the UAG has two hospitals, one Experimental Agricultural Center, the Marine Sciences Station on the Pacific Ocean coast, and 3 university hotels and convention centers. The U.A.G. has a current enrollment of around 12,000 students, 85% of whom are Mexican, while 15% come from 25 different countries. The institution employs around 300 full-time and 900 part-time, highly qualified, faculty members. Within the areas mentioned above, the UAG offers 40 undergraduate majors, 73 master’s programs and graduate specialization, 2 doctoral degrees and 17 associate degree programs.

name: Universidad Autónoma del Estado de Hidalgo (UAEH)
description: Universidad Autónoma del Estado de Hidalgo UAEH has built an academic leadership positioning itself as one of the best universities in Mexico for postgraduate studies. Such leadership is enabled by the vanguard that UAEH has demonstrated through its programs and by its relevance, feasibility, high update rate and quality, assured through a certification by external organizations such as the National Council for Science and Technology (Spanish: Consejo Nacional de Ciencia y Tecnología CONACyT and its National Quality Graduate Program (Programa Nacional de Posgrados de Calidad PNPC), where UAEH has 22 registered programs. This places UAEH statewide with the first place at a state level and the 74% of all programs certified for its high academic quality in Hidalgo.The main objective of the postgraduate programs is to develop human resources of a highest level to generate knowledge, development and technological innovation to address social problems and public or private management matters.

name: Universidad Autónoma del Estado de México (UAEMex)
description:
Universidad Autónoma del Estado de México (UAEM) was founded in 1828 as the Literary Institute of the State of Mexico. In 1956 it is consolidated as a public university that aims to generate, study, preserve, transmit and extend universal knowledge and be at the service of society, in order to contribute to the achievement of new and better ways of human existence and coexistence, and to promote a universal, humanistic, national, free, fair and democratic conscience.

The UAEM has hosted distinguished academics, philosophers and poets, as well as important personalities for the Mexican nation, such as the former President of México Adolfo López Mateos and liberal thinkers as Ignacio Ramirez Calzada and Ignacio Manuel Altamirano.

Among its projects with greater international impact is the development of Network of Scientific Journals of Latin America and the Caribbean, Spain and Portugal, Redalyc, a scientific information system that promotes open access in Latin America.

It is located in the State of Mexico, an entity located in the center of the country and surrounding the city of Mexico. At the international level, the UAEM has liaison offices at: University of Hildesheim (HUS), Germany; University of North Texas (UNT), United States of America; University of Santiago de Compostela (USC), Spain and Manuel Valiente, in Rome, Italy.

name: Universidad Católica del Norte
description: Located in the Chilean port city of Antofagasta, the Catholic University of the North was founded in 1956. Teaching at the university is split across seven faculties, with teaching occurring across two main campuses as well as a separate museum and research center in San Pedro de Atacama and an astronomy center. The university has a total of seven research centers as well as a Scientific and Technological Park. More information about the degree programs available at the university can be found on their official website.

name: Universidad Central "Marta Abreu" de Las Villas
description: Based in the Cuban capital city of Santa Clara, the University “Marta Abreu” of Las Villas was first established in the early 1950s before the Cuban Revolution. Providing both undergraduate and graduate education, the university is divided into 13 departments. The university also has a remote campus located in Topes de Collantes, a nature reserve in the Escambray Mountains. In total, the student body across all departments and campus locations numbers approximately 7,500.

name: Universidad Científica del Sur
description:
El 5 de febrero de 1998, en la ciudad de Lima, el Consejo Nacional para la Autorización de Funcionamiento de Universidades (CONAFU) aprobó el funcionamiento de la Universidad Científica del Sur, mediante Resolución N° 356-98-CONAFU. Su primera Comisión Organizadora tuvo como Presidente al sabio peruano Dr. Fernando Cabieses Molina, quien fuera nuestro primer Rector, manteniéndose el Ing. Dextre como Presidente del Directorio de la asociación promotora. Junto a ellos, el Dr. José Chacón Polar, distinguido médico peruano de destacada trayectoria y primer Vicepresidente Académico, completó el grupo directivo fundador.

En setiembre de 1998 se inauguraron las actividades académicas en la nueva Universidad. Iniciamos con cincuenta alumnos agrupados en dos carreras: Medicina Humana e Ingeniería de Sistemas.

Iniciamos con dos carreras y cincuenta alumnos. Hoy ofrecemos diecisiete carreras a más de dos mil alumnos seleccionados cuidadosamente. Nuestro Campus, de diseño ambiental, está ubicado en la zona ecológica de los Pantanos de Villa, y ha sido considerado como uno de los más innovadores a nivel nacional.

name: Universidad Industrial de Santander - UIS
description:
TheUniversidad
Industrial de Santanderis located in Bucaramanga which
is known as "The Beautiful City", in northeast of Colombia.

Bucaramanga is the capital of the Santander region and
is surrounded by the Chicamocha Canyon, the Páramo de Berlín and the
municipality of Lebrija.

UIS opened
in 1948 to meet the need for engineers in Colombia when industry began to
flourish and was one of the first public universities to obtain (and maintain)
high quality accreditation from the Ministry of Education in Colombia.

The university’s
main campus is in Bucaramanga (with five locations) and four other campuses
throughout Santander. It has about 23,000 students: 19,000 undergraduate and
4,000 graduate students.

The
university has six deaneries, 36 departments and offers 45 undergraduate programmes;
it also has 49 graduate specialisation programmes, 50 master's degrees and 10
doctorates. There are around 1,891 faculty members, and 1,087 administrative
members.

UIS houses
one of the three technology parks supported by the Ministry of Science of
Colombia, Guatiguará Technology Park, which has 14 research centres and
specialised laboratories. Additionally, UIS holds about 98 research groups, 11
scientific journals and 73 national and international patents, with more applications
for intellectual property in the process.

Programmes
are taught in Spanish; however, the university has a Foreign Languages programme
with a major in English and a bachelor’s in literature taught in English,
French and Portuguese. Courses in Spanish as a second language for
international students are offered.

UIS’s   Language Institute   enables students to take up to level 5 English
and two levels in French, Portuguese and Italian. German and Korean is also
offered through the language assistants programme, and through university
partnerships, Mandarin-Chinese is also available.

name: Universidad Nacional de Cuyo
description: The University of Cuyo is located in the province of Mendoza, Argentina, and was established in 1939. It is composed by 12 faculties and three specialized institutes, offering a wide range of undergraduate, graduate and postgraduate studies. It is currently the largest centre of higher education in the west of Argentina.

name: Universidad Nacional de Ingeniería
description:
The Universidad Nacional de Ingeniería(National University of Engineering), often referred to as UNI, is a prestigious public university in Peru.

Founded in 1876, UNI is recognised for its significant contributions to science, technology, and engineering. Located in the capital city of Lima, UNI is known for producingsome of the country's most influential engineers and innovators. With astrong emphasis on research and practical applications, the university isdedicated to addressing Peru’s and the world’s technological challenges.

As one of the country’s most prestigious universities, UNI offersa wide range ofundergraduate, andpostgraduateprogrammes spanningarchitecture, engineering and science.

Over the years, the university has garnered respect not only for its academic excellence but also forits active engagement with industries and public organisations, fostering a culture of innovation and problem-solving. UNI's commitment to both education andresearchcontinues to attract students from across Peru and beyond.

Why choose UNI?

Explore more about life at UNIvia theirFacebook,X,YouTubeandInstagrampages.

name: Universidad Nacional de San Luis
description: The National University of San Luis located in San Luis, Argentina and was founded in 1973. There are eight faculties offering both undergraduate and postgraduate programs at the National University of San Luis.

name: Universidad Nacional de la Asunción
description: Located in the Paraguayan city of San Lorenzo, the Universidad Nacional de Asunción (otherwise known as the National University of Asuncion) is the oldest university in Paraguay. Founded in 1889, the university has grown to encompass a dozen different schools, having initially only focused on law, medicine, mathematics, pharmacy, obstetrics and a clerical school. The university has campuses spread across the whole of Paraguay, with more than a dozen additional locations supplementing the main campus in San Lorenzo. Approximately 40,000 students are currently enrolled at the university. For more information about how to apply, visit the university website.

name: Universidad Nacional del Centro de la Provincia de Buenos Aires (UNICEN)
Universidad Nacional del Litoral
description:
The Universidad Nacional del Litoral (UNL) is an institution based in Santa Fe, Argentina that was established in 1919. The university contains ten faculties offering both undergraduate and postgraduate programs.

Universidad Nacional del Litoral was established under National Act Nº 10.861, which was enacted on October 17th, 1919. The university is the result of the 1918 University Reform movement in Argentina, which advocated for the creation of democratic and self-governing institutions to provide free, open and public higher education. These ideas eventually spread to much of the rest of Latin America.

UNL is based in the province of Santa Fe, in the central area of Argentina. The university’s main building is located at 2750 Bv. Pellegrini Street, in the city of Santa Fe, but the university also has schools, institutes and faculties in nearby cities, namely Esperanza, Reconquista, Avellaneda, Gálvez, Rafaela and Sunchales. The city of Santa Fe is the historical site, the “center of gravity” of the university since it is here where most academic units can be found. The city of Esperanza is the link between the university and the rural cluster, whereas the cities of Reconquista, Avellaneda, Gálvez, Rafaela and Sunchales are growing into new areas of social and educational development with a strong regional impact. The University is made up of ten Faculties, two University Centers, a University Venue, a Higher Institute, three Middle Level Schools and a Primary Level School and Kindergarten. Careers belonging to different areas of scientific, humanistic, technical and cultural knowledge are dictated in each of the academic units, which are consubstantiated with the problems of the region where the University is inserted. In Santa Fe the UNL has a University City where it concentrates a large part of its academic, sports and recreational activity. Nearly 50 percent of all University students attend there every day. This space has parking lots, checkpoints and bus stops, bike paths and recreational spaces. On the west sector is the Ecological Reserve and the UNL-ATE Estate where the University Dining Room and the Health Center work. This urban complex is made up of the following buildings and areas: –Faculty of Biochemistry and Biological Sciences (FBCB) –Faculty of Medical Sciences (FCM) –Faculty of Engineering and Water Sciences (FICH) –Faculty of Humanities and Sciences (FHUC) –Faculty of Architecture, Design and Urbanism (FADU) -Superior Institute of Music (ISM) - Superior School of Health (ESS) -National Institute of Limnology (INALI) -Hydraulic Laboratory -Common lecturer for the academic units of the University City In the city of Santa Fe there are also the Faculty of Economic Sciences (FCE), the Faculty of Legal and Social Sciences (FCJS), which shares the Rectorate building, and the Faculty of Chemical Engineering (FIQ), with shares the building with the Higher Industrial School, the Secondary School, the primary and initial, and the Language Center. In Esperanza, the University has the headquarters of two of its faculties: Agricultural Sciences and Veterinary Sciences (FCA and FCV). Both, together with a complex service infrastructure, make up the Fave Campus, where academic, scientific, sports , leisure activities take place and a university canteen headquarters. The School of Agriculture, Livestock and Farm (EAGG) is located in the city as well. The Reconquista-Avellaneda University Center (CURA), in Reconquista, the Gálvez University Center (CUG) in Gálvez, and the Rafaela/Sunchales Headquarters (Sede RS) in Rafaela, are part of the UNL and operate in the región.

There are 14 institutes of double dependency articulated with the National Council for Scientific and Technological Research (CONICET), whose objective is to carry out research in different disciplinary fields, train human resources and transfer the results of research to the socio-productive sector. https://www.unl.edu.ar/investigacion/institutos-unl-conicet/

name: Universidad Nacional Costa Rica
description:
Universidad Nacional Costa Rica is a public university in the Republic of Costa Rica, in Central America. The main campus is located in the city of Heredia. It is one of five public universities in the country and the second most prestigious. More than 12,000 students study at its main campus. In addition to undergraduate programs, it offers 16 Master of Arts degrees and is strong in ecology, sociology and education related coursework.

UNA offers more than 65 graduate and postgraduate degree programs in various fields, such as natural sciences, earth and marine sciences, education, social sciences, health sciences, philosophy, literature and arts

name: Universidad Tecnológica Nacional (UTN)
description:
Universidad Tecnológica Nacional, UTN is a country-wide national university in Argentina, and considered to be among the top engineering schools in the country. Hosting over 75,000 students, its student body is comparable to Argentina's third-largest university. It has 29 semi-independent branches of various sizes located all over the country.

The engineering programs taught at most of those locations are:

name: Universidad Tecnológica de Panamá (UTP)
description: The second-largest university in Panama, Universidad Tecnológica de Panamá (UTP) has seven campuses nationwide. The main one of these spans 60 hectares and is located in Panama City, the nation’s capital. Ranked joint 119th in Latin America in the QS World University Rankings by Region 2019, the university is comprised of six faculties: Civil Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Industrial Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, Computer Systems Engineering, and Science and Technology.

name: Universidad de La Frontera (UFRO)
description: Ubicada en Temuco Chile, la Universidad de La Frontera se fundó en 1981 y alberga seis colegios y facultades. La universidad ofrece 46 títulos de pregrado, 12 programas de doctorado y 31 programas de maestría.

name: Universidad de Las Américas Ecuador
description:
Universidad de Las Américas (UDLA) is a private, non-profit institution of higher education in Quito, Ecuador.   Founded in 1994, UDLA has established itself as a university that embraces change with a spirit of innovation and a forward-looking institutional culture that responds to student´s needs and a dynamic global society.

From its early days, UDLA has grown to the largest self-financed university in Ecuador, with four state-of-the-art facilities plus an experimental farm and an ever-increasing presence in research.   Today the university serves around 17,000 students in more than 60 undergraduate and graduate programs across the disciplines: health sciences, engineering, architecture and design, business, gastronomy, communication, tourism, psychology, film, and music.

UDLA is the only Ecuadorian university to hold institutional accreditation from a U.S. regional accrediting agency, WASC Senior College and University Commission (WSCUC).  UDLA offers six-month exchange programs to international students who are fluent in Spanish and seeking to spend a semester in Ecuador, as well as the chance to apply for full degrees at UDLA from overseas.

name: Universidad de Lima
description:
With over 60 years of academic excellence,Universidad
de Limadelivers innovative, scientific and interdisciplinary education
designed to shape the next generation of leaders committed to the welfare of
society. It promotes innovation and creation of solutions that address both
local and global challenges, driven by a business-oriented vision that fosters
ethics and responsibility. Built on four key pillars—innovation and research,
internationalization, sustainability, and business partnerships—Ulima model is designed
to drive educational achievement and help students succeed in their careers.

The University engages its community in innovative
projects with social, economic, and environmental impact through centers and
institutes such as the Sustainability Center (Responde Ulima), Scientific
Research Institute (IDIC), Center for Entrepreneurship (Innova Ulima),
Technological Observatory, and Economic, Financial, and Social Observatory.

Students have the opportunity to participate in
exchange programs with over 170 universities across 26 countries in America,
Europe, Asia, and Oceania. They can also earn a second international bachelor’s
degree from prestigious universities in France, United Kingdom, and Australia.

For more information, clickhere.

name: Universidad de Los Andes - (ULA) Mérida
description:
Universidad de Los Andes is the second-oldest university in Venezuela, whose main campus is located in the city of Mérida, Venezuela. ULA is the largest public university in the Venezuelan Andes, having one of the largest student bodies in the country.

ULA was initially established as a Catholic seminary on March 29, 1785 by the Bishop of Mérida, Friar Juan Ramos de Lora.

Currently, Universidad de Los Andes operates two campuses in Mérida, with about a dozen faculties spread throughout the city, as well as two satellite campuses in the other Venezuelan Andean states of Tachira and Trujillo.

name: Universidad de Monterrey (UDEM)
description:
Universidad de Monterreyis a private institution of higher education that offers an education of excellence with values. It has international acknowledgements such as the Southern Association of Colleges and School Commission on Colleges, the Association to Advance Collegiate Schools of Business, the Association of MBAs accreditations and is ranked number 3 in Mexico for its contribution to the Sustainable Development Goals.

UDEM has a population that exceeds 16,000 students. Currently, it offers 46 academic programs at the bachelor's level, 18 master's programs, 13 graduate specialties, 1 doctorate and 37 medical specialty programs.

name: Universidad de Valparaíso (UV)
description:
The University de Valparaíso is a state institution, public and autonomous, based on a long tradition and his mission is to generate and disseminate knowledge cultivating science and technology, humanities and arts, through the development of programs for undergraduate, graduate and research, providing skills to train graduates, professionals and researchers that society requires, in a frame of quality management and commitment to regional and national development.

The values that inspires are participation, solidarity, equity, freedom, pluralism, critical thinking and respect to diversity.

In this university are developed activities of education, research and extension in all the 11 faculties; we have 43 Undergraduate programs, 25 Magister programs, 10 Doctorate programs, 28 Medical specialities and 9 Dentistry specialities, in order to satisfy completely its 17thousands students and the necessities and interests of the country and mainly of the Valparaíso region.

name: Universidad del Valle de Guatemala (UVG)
description:
Universidad
del Valle de Guatemala (UVG)is one of the most prestigious universities in Central America. We are
at the forefront of technology and committed to advancing high-level research
and teaching.  We
are proud to be the only university in Guatemala included in theQS World
University Rankings 2026: Top global universities, as well as the only one
with international institutional accreditation from Hcéres.

Since 1966,
we have welcomed talented individuals who aspire to become agents of change. We
offer a distinctive educational model that integrates a strong liberal arts
foundation with specialized training in science, technology, innovation,
education, and business. Our academic programs, research agenda, and community
engagement initiatives are aligned with the evolving needs of society and
promote creative solutions to the most pressing challenges of our time.

We
understand the urgency of driving meaningful change, which is why our
forward-thinking educational model is focused on competency development and
active, collaborative learning. This approach is brought to life through
hands-on projects with industry partners, a strong emphasis on innovation, a
thriving maker culture, multidisciplinary perspectives, and the strengthening
of critical thinking skills.

UVGis known for its student-centered
approach and academic excellence grounded in values. Across our three campuses,
we provide financial aid and scholarships to high-potential students from
underserved communities, fostering equity and social mobility.

Our
graduates are recognized for their leadership, ethical commitment, and ability
to contribute to innovation and sustainable development in Guatemala and
beyond. UVG maintains strategic partnerships with leading universities and
institutions worldwide, promoting international collaboration, student and
faculty exchange, and joint research projects.

name: Universidade Federal Fluminense
description: The Federal Fluminense University was created in 1960 with the Federal University name of the State of Rio de Janeiro (UFERJ). After being nationalized and incorporated this union was renamed Universidade Federal Fluminense. The mission of UFF is to produce, disseminate and apply knowledge and culture critically and socially relevant. The institution has academic units in eight municipalities in the state of Rio de Janeiro. Today, the UFF consists of 40  teaching units and 23 institutes, 10 faculties, 6 schools and 1 college application. Altogether there are 124  Departments of Education, 129 face Degree and6 Graduate Distance learning courses offered in 28 Polos the Open University of Brazil , inpartnership with the CEDERJ-RJ. In Postgraduate stricto sensu are 80 Postgraduate programs and 119 courses, with 42 PhD, 59 Masters and 18 Masters Academic Professionals. The Graduate Lato Sensu has 131 specialization courses and 32 medical residency programs.  In 2015, the UFF registered  6,305 students of Postgraduate stricto sensu, with 2,184 Doctoral, 3,072 in the Academic Master's and 1,049 in Masters Professionals. In Specialization recorded 212 medical residents and 11,943 students in the Specialization Distance.The UFF still has the Antonio Pedro University Hospital with 276 beds, the University Pharmacy and Application College. State of Pará. In addition to a Publisher and four bookstores in the Cultural Area, UFF has an Arts Centre,and an orchestra.

name: Universidade Federal da Bahia
description:
The Federal University of Bahia – UFBA – is an institution part of the Brazilian Federal System of Higher Education, based in the city of Salvador, State of Bahia, where it offers 93 graduation courses and 123 post-graduation courses (master’s and doctorate), with approximately 39.000 registered students. Besides its headquarters, UFBA has a campus in the city of Vitória da Conquista – Bahia, which offers 7 graduation courses and 4 post-graduation courses, with about 1.000 registered students.

It is the eldest university of the region, acting in all fields of knowledge and with an important role in the education of qualified professionals with notable performance in academic research and extension, contributing to the scientific, technologic, artistic and cultural development, and reconciling an expanding international insertion and strong engagement in the commitment to the social, local and regional demands.

The Federal University of Bahia is oriented by a set of values, which guarantee the fulfillment of its institutional objectives, as discriminated in its Institutional Development Plan – PDI, available at https://proplan.ufba.br/documentacao-legislacao/pdi:

·       Inseparability between tuition, research and extension

·       Search for excellence in its activities and objectives

·       Respect to diversity and engagement against all forms of intolerance and discrimination

·       Intellectual openness and rigor, creativity and search for innovation

·       Valuing of people, dialogue, transparency and stimulation of cooperation

·       Respect to history and openness to contemporaneity

·       Ethical rigor in its decisions and actions

·       Search for equity in the access and permanence in the university

·       Pluralism of ideas, promotion of democratic values and citizenship

·       Commitment to the social transformation

·       Public, free and autonomous character for the university

·       Sustainability and environmental responsibility

A panorama of its dimensions and main activities performed in the last 70 years, ‘UFBA IN NUMBERS RETROSPECTIVE: SPECIAL 70 YEARS’, may be accessed at:

https://proplan.ufba.br/sites/proplan.ufba.br/files/UFBA%20in%20numbers%20Retrospective%20Special%2070%20Years_1.pdf.

name: Universidade Federal de Pernambuco (UFPE)
description: The Universidade Federal de Pernambuco was founded in 1946, in Recife, capital of the State of Pernambuco (UFPE). It is one of the best universities in the country in teaching (undergraduate and post graduate) and scientific research, and it is the best in the North-Northeast region, according to evaluations of the Ministries of Education (MEC) and Science and Technology (MCT). In recent years, with support from the Federal Government, UFPE expanded its operations - building two campuses in the interior of the state, in the cities of Vitória de Santo Antão and Caruaru - and created new courses in response to economic and social demands, such as Cinema, Archaeology, Museology, Dance, Information Systems, Materials Engineering, Energy Engineering and Naval Engineering.

name: Universidade Federal de Santa Maria
description: The Universidade Federal de Santa Maria (UFSM) is a prestigious tuition-free university located in an attractive medium-sized city in southern Brazil. The region is known for its safety, stunning beauty, high quality of life, diverse culture and friendly people. The region is considered a prominent center for paleontology and boasts two UNESCO Geoparks. It is located near Argentina and Uruguay.   In 2023, UFSM was ranked 13th among Brazilian Federal Universities. UFSM offers a wide variety of programs, with 130 undergraduate programs. UFSM’s undergraduate degree programs are divided into the following major areas of knowledge: Agricultural and Animal Sciences, Health Sciences, Natural and Exact Sciences, Humanities and Social Sciences, Languages and Arts, Education and Technology. The university prides itself on its commitment to providing a comprehensive education that encompasses a broad range of fields.   The university has a student body of approximately 27,000 undergraduate students enrolled in programs offered across its four campuses, with over 4,000 students enrolled in 108 graduate programs. UFSM has a reputation for excellence in research, with cutting-edge laboratories, a technology park, and a large campus with vast areas for field research. The university also has a teaching hospital and veterinary hospital, providing excellent hands-on training opportunities for students. The total area of the university is 4,604 acres, making it one of the largest and most comprehensive universities in Brazil.

name: Universidade Federal de Viçosa (UFV)
description: The Universidade Federal de Viçosa (UFV) stands out in national and international scene as a center of excellence in teaching, research and extension activities, ranked as one of the top ten universities in Brazil. It is internationally recognized for its graduate programs in Phytopathology, Entomology, Plant Physiology, Animal Science, Agricultural Microbiology, Genetics and Breeding, Soils and Plant Nutrition and Food Science and Technology. The UFV is composed of three campuses and offers 68 undergraduate and 49 graduate programs. The institution’s student body is composed of students from over 40 nationalities. Investing in a policy of  engagement and dissemination of knowledge, UFV offers opportunities of interchange programs, keeping agreements with nearly 100 institutions from 24 different countries. The UFV also offers a wide infrastructure that includes laboratories, forest reserves, library, sports and leisure areas, restaurants, banks, and medical services. The UFV is located in the state of Minas Gerais in southeastern Brazil. This region, besides having the most developed agriculture of the country, stands out for its industrial development, representing the most important economic region of Brazil. The Universidade Federal de Viçosa seeks effective dialogue with different political sectors and the civil society, renewing its commitment to the production and dissemination of knowledge, contributing to improving the quality of life in Brazil and worldwide. The Universidade Federal de Viçosa (UFV) stands out in national and international scene as a center of excellence in teaching, research and extension activities, ranked as one of the top ten universities in Brazil. It is internationally recognized for its graduate programs in Phytopathology, Entomology, Plant Physiology, Animal Science, Agricultural Microbiology, Genetics and Breeding, Soils and Plant Nutrition and Food Science and Technology. The UFV is composed of three campuses and offers 67 undergraduate and 47 graduate programs. The institution’s student body is composed of students from over 40 nationalities. Investing in a policy of engagement and dissemination of knowledge, UFV offers opportunities of interchange programs, keeping agreements with nearly 100 institutions from 24 different countries. The UFV also offers a wide infrastructure that includes laboratories, forest reserves, library, sports and leisure areas, restaurants, banks, and medical services. The UFV is located in the state of Minas Gerais in southeastern Brazil. This region, besides having the most developed agriculture of the country, stands out for its industrial development, representing the most important economic region of Brazil. The Universidade Federal de Viçosa seeks effective dialogue with different political sectors and the civil society, renewing its commitment to the production and dissemination of knowledge, contributing to improving the quality of life in Brazil and worldwide.

name: Universidade Presbiteriana Mackenzie
description:
Mackenzie Presbyterian University (Universidade Presbiteriana Mackenzie) is a private university in São Paulo, Brazil. The Mackenzie Presbyterian University is an institution of higher learning that has strong tradition and history in Brazil. It has campuses for undergraduate and postgraduate studies in São Paulo (Campus Higienópolis), Campinas and Barueri (Campus Alphaville).

Founded in 1870 as the American School, Mackenzie is one of the oldest institutions of higher education in Brazil. The university is regarded nationally and internationally as a center of excellence having graduated numerous important names in Brazilian history.

The nickname "Mackenzista" is often used to refer to present or former students of Mackenzie.

name: Universidade do Estado do Rio de Janeiro (UERJ)
description: Rio de Janeiro State University (known as UERJ) was born in 1950 and has, since then, grown and established itself as one of the main higher education institutions in Brazil. Its importance in the national and international academic scene can be proved by the quality of its upper education, its scientifi c research, besides hundreds of extension projects related to the promotion of culture.

name: Università degli Studi di Urbino Carlo Bo - Carlo Bo University of Urbino
description:
Carlo Bo University of Urbino (Università degli Studi di Urbino Carlo Bo) is located in Urbino and has an impressive history, as it was founded in 1506 and in the 1920s, gained recognition as an "Independent University".

The university used to be divided into 11 faculties, but since 2013, the institution adopted a department-based structure and is composed of the following 6 departments:

name: Universitas Muhammadiyah Yogyakarta
description:
Established in 1981, Universitas Muhammadiyah Yogyakarta (UMY) is located in Yogyakarta, Indonesia. Yogyakarta (also recognized as Yogya or Jogja) in the middle of Java Island.

Jogja is well-known as a traditional city. The local landscape offers several mountains, beaches, and tourist spots.

There are over 90 educational institutes in Jogja – making it a popular student option. The city is also very affordable for students.

Yogyakarta also has reliable city transportation. Students can easily access the city bus transportation "Trans Jogja", using a motorcycle "ojek" or calling for a cab. Online ride-hailing services such as Go-Jek and Grab are also available.

There are affordable amenities throughout Yogyakarta at stalls, mini markets, malls, and local traditional markets. Students can enjoy Yogyakarta traditional cuisine, as well as traditional Indonesian and international dishes.

As a modern Islamic University, UMY’s vision is to create leading and enlightening graduates. In line with its vision, UMY does not only direct its students to master the latest science and technology but it also guides the students to develop culturally and religiously in line with Islamic values.

Situated in Yogyakarta where culture and tradition are strongly preserved, UMY students will obtain balanced experience between a strong on-campus academic atmosphere and an enriching off-campus social life.

UMY provides many opportunities to engage socially-in activities as one of the most reputable and vibrant Universities in Indonesia. The university is committed to focusing not only on academics and research but also on community empowerment and social responsibility.

UMY offers exchange programmes, internships, summer courses, short courses, and double degree programmes – many in partnership with other universities.

UMY uses Indonesian as the main language for teaching. However, English is used for international classes including: International Relations (IPIREL), Law & Sharia (IPOLS), Islamic Economics & Finance (IPIEF), Government Affairs and Administration (IGOV), Accounting (IPAcc), Management and Business (IMaBs), Islamic Communication (IPICOM), and Communication Studies (IP-Cos).

name: Universitas Pendidikan Indonesia
description: UPI was established on 20 October 1954 under the name Teacher Education and Training Colleges (PTPG). On 25 October 1958, PTPG became a Faculty of Education of Padjadjajaran University (UNPAD). On 1 May 1963, FKIP and other Teacher Education Institutes merged into the Institute for Teacher Training and Pedagogy (IKIP Bandung) with the main responsibility of preparing junior and senior high school teachers. In 1990, UPI was also responsible for preparing pre-school and primary school teachers through diploma and later undergraduate program. On 7 October 1999, IKIP Bandung changed its nomenclature to Universitas Pendidikan Indonesia, which is responsible for preparing not only prospective teachers but also those who will work in noneducation fields. UPI has a School of Postgraduate Studies and eight faculties which run undergraduate and diploma programs. Those eight faculties are Faculty of Educational Sciences, Faculty of Social Studies Education, Faculty of Language and Literature Education, Faculty of Mathematics and Science Education, Faculty of Technology and Vocational Education, and Faculty of Physical and Health Education, Faculty of Economy and Business Education, and Faculty of Arts and Design Education. UPI currently has about 32,000 students whose figure shows a 5% annual increase and employs 1,327 teaching staff, many of whom have gain international recognition, and 1189 administrative staff. At its 65 years of age, it has produced 188.306 graduates. The alumni spread all over the country and work as educational professionals or policy makers in various government bodies. Starting in 2019, UPI is appointed by the Indonesian government to become the Center of Excellence for Vocational Teacher Education (COE for TVET) to support the government ambition to produce more competent and competitive vocational workers.

name: Universitas Trisakti (USAKTI)
description:
Universitas Trisakti (USAKTI)is located in Jakarta, Indonesia and offers 47 study programmes spread throughout nine faculties including diploma, bachelor’s, master’s, doctoral, and professional degree levels.

Universitas Trisakti is a private university that has achieved much since its establishment in 1965. It possesses an A accreditation rank from BAN-PT, and ranks 27th of all universities in Indonesia. It is one of a few universities that possess five stars for Teaching Quality in the QS Stars assessment. More than 50% of the study programs have an A rank accreditation and some of them have even qualified with Superior predicate.

Some of the study programs obtain certification from AUN-QA and ISO 9001:2015. Universitas Trisakti has almost 150,000 alumni spread throughout the world: from government to private sectors as entrepreneurs and competent leaders in their respective field. The USAKTI alumni association is a strong, diverse and effective network.

Find out moreabout life at Universitas Trisakti via its social media channels, includingFacebook,Instagram,TwitterandYouTube.

name: Universitatea de Vest din Timisoara /  West University of Timisoara
description: The University was founded by the decree law no. 660 issued on 30 December 1944, which stipulates that a university must be created in western Romania. Its first faculties either were dissolved or became independent institutions. These independent higher education institutions became a sole university at the end of September 1962. By 1968, our institution had become an independent university, with a prestigious academic staff; this was the ideal for which many leading Romanian intellectuals, especially those from the Banat region, had fought. Unfortunately, there followed a difficult period for Humanities and Exact Sciences. Fields of study such as Music, Fine arts, History, Geography, Biology, and Chemistry disappeared one by one; Philology was considerably reduced. As a result, many of the faculties were transferred to other institutions. 1989, the year of the Romanian revolution, was a turning point in the evolution of our university. It led to the present-day conditions. That is why the current structures and achievements make the University a trusted partner. An essential mentality change took place in the perception of the academic institution, in accordance with the democratic institutions in Western Europe. A substantial institutional reform was carried out, beginning with the redefining of the university’s mission by establishing its objectives.

name: Universiti Kuala Lumpur (UniKL)
description:
Universiti Kuala Lumpur (UniKL) is a leading university in engineering technology established on 20 August 2002. Wholly owned by Majlis Amanah Rakyat (MARA), an agency under the Ministry of Rural and Regional Development (KKLW), Malaysia, the university is given the mandate to upgrade the status of technical education in Malaysia by the government. As the nation expects more from a technical higher learning institutions, UniKL mould its graduate with strong technological knowledge and astute entrepreneurial skills who would later fulfill the current demand of the industries. UniKL's 14 branch institutes offer various foundation, diploma, undergraduate and postgraduate programmes. With the concept of ‘One Institute, One Specialisation', UniKL contributes not only to tertiary education but also researches and development for commercialisation purposes. Strategically located all over peninsular Malaysia, UniKL's branch institutes offer various programmes in theirs niche areas of specialisation.

At Present, UniKL Boasts a total of 29, 043 students. Since its inception, UniKL has produced 37,210 graduates. Graduates of UniKL have successfully established their careers or become successful entrepreneurs in local and international arena.

name: Universiti Malaysia Kelantan
UNIVERSITI TEKNIKAL MALAYSIA MELAKA
description: Universiti Teknikal Malaysia Melaka (UTeM) was established on December 1, 2000. UTeM pioneers the “practice and application oriented” teaching and learning methodology for higher technical education in Malaysia. This is in accordance with the government’s decision to cater for high technical-skilled human resource needs of Malaysia’s industries.UTeM has seven distinct faculties which provide in-depth specialization in engineering, engineering technology, ICT and technology management disciplines along with the Institute of Technology Management and Tecnopreneurship and Centre for Languages and Human Development. The university offers academic programs at Diploma, Bachelor, Masters and PhD levels.The programmes offered at UTeM are highly specialised. Currently, UTeM offers 10 engineering technology programs with the highest student enrolment of 2,600, which also represents 60% of total student enrolment at UTeM. The curriculum is developed closely with industry experts and aligned to the national agenda for Technical and Vocational Education and Training (TVET) to ensure its quality and relevance meet the needs of the thriving industrial sectors and further produces highly-skilled human resources for the development of Malaysia towards a high-income nation by 2020.UTeM admits not only local but also international students and this includes students from Indonesia, Korea, Saudi Arabia, India, Singapore, Palestine, among others.

name: University of Babylon
description: The university of Babylon is a non-profit comprehensive public higher education institution. It was established on the 25th of Apr, 1991,  90 km south of the capital Baghdad in Babil governorate . Officially accredited/recognized by the Ministry of Higher Education and  Scientific Research. The university has twenty colleges/ faculties  and nine scientific and cultural centers as well as nine  scientific and educational journals. University of Babylon is a comprehensive multi-disciplines academic institutions, offers  various degrees under and post graduate degrees  according to its 2000  academic staff in multi specializations. University offers scholarships with full funded fees especially to applicants from developing countries that is within its strategic plan to support global sustainable developing goals . About 25000 undergraduate students and about 1500 postgraduate students are attending the university. University of Babylon also provides several academic and non-academic facilities,  student services including libraries, housing, sport facilities and volunteer activities, financial aids and scholarships. University welcomes to participate and activate international collaboration and cultural exchange  programs.

name: University of Basrah
description:
The University of Basrah stands as the most ancient and largest institution of higher education in the southern region of Iraq. Established in 1964, it was designed to address the educational requirements of the local populace. At present, the university comprises 21 colleges and 9 research centers, including the Marine Sciences Centre, Date-Palm Research Center, Center of Polymers, Center for Arabian Gulf Studies, and Center for Life Languages, among others. The institution possesses a historical museum that houses an impressive collection of artifacts. The university is distributed across five primary campuses within the Basrah province: The initial campus, which serves as the university's main office, is located in the urban center of Basrah City in Al-Ashar, adjacent to the banks of the Shat Al-Arab river. The second campus is situated to the west of the city center in Bab-Al-Zubair and accommodates Al Zahraa College of Medicine alongside the Colleges of Arts, Fine Arts, Law, Administration and Economics, Education for Women, various research centers, and the Central Library. The subsequent campus is positioned to the north of the city, in Hartha (Garmat Ali), and includes the Colleges of Engineering, Sciences, Education for Physical Sciences, Education for Humanities, Agriculture, Veterinary Medicine, Physical Education and Sport Sciences, Pharmacy, Computer Sciences and Information Technology, Marine Sciences, as well as several research centers.

The third campus is located to the east of the city in Al-Bradeiae and comprises the Colleges of Health Sciences, including Basrah College of Medicine, College of Dentistry, and College of Nursing at Basrah Teaching Hospital, in addition to the College of Education situated in Qurnah, approximately 80 kilometers north of Basrah. This campus is equipped with a science museum and a medicine museum, which is part of the College of Medicine. Furthermore, it includes a consulting medical center, numerous teaching hospitals, and a new university hospital currently under construction. The governance of the university is overseen by a council consisting of 29 members, including the Chancellor (currently Professor Dr. Saad Shaheen Hammadi, a Consultant in Internal Medicine), two vice-chancellors (one responsible for scientific affairs and the other for administrative matters), Deans from the 22 colleges, representatives from the faculty staff and research centers, the Head of the Department of Quality and Academic Performance, and the council's rapporteur. The Chancellery office is strategically located along the Shat Al-Arab waterway, in proximity to the Central Bank. As of now, the University of Basrah employs over 2,818 faculty members, which includes 304 full professors. The total enrollment of undergraduate students is 38,101. Advanced study programs are offered in the majority of the university's colleges; thus far, 139 PhD programs and 399 Master's programs across various disciplines have been conferred. The university publishes 22 scientific journals across diverse specialties and maintains cultural affiliations with numerous institutions globally, including those in the USA (Arkansas and Houston) and Iran (Esfahan, Shaheed Jumran, Tabriz). Recently, the university established a FOOD BANK to support students living below the poverty line. The institution is committed to sustainability within its campuses and the broader community, with further details available at https://en.sustainability.uobasrah.edu.iq/

name: University of Derby
description:
Located in the heart of England, we are the only university in Derby and Derbyshire. We offer industry-relevant, research-informed courses, expert teaching and strong industry links which create unrivalled career opportunities. We partner for impact, meaning that we are committed to creating a collaborative environment where graduate talent can flourish.
