The city of Derby has a long-standing reputation for extraordinary innovation which the University of Derby aims to build upon, using our knowledge to support the prosperity of our region, nation and the world.

We are awarded Gold in the prestigious Teaching Excellence Framework (TEF) 2023, making us one of the top universities in the country recognised for outstanding student experience and student outcomes. We are ranked 4th for employability, 5th for course quality and 15th overall in the Uni Compare Annual Student Review Rankings 2025, we are focused on preparing students for a successful future.

Proudly named Top 25 in the UK for overall student satisfaction in the Complete University Guide 2025 and Top 25 for teaching quality in the Times and Sunday Times Good University Guide 2025.

What makes us different?

We are a problem centric, solution focused University with a strong philosophy around shaping tomorrow, today.

Our students, graduates and staff are making an impact in our region and around the world by using their expertise and experience to drive innovation and make positive changes. You can be part of that story.

We are continuously investing in our facilities and will soon be adding a £14.4 million Bioscience Superlab. A brand-new state-of-the-art Business School is also set to open near the city centre as a modern, zero carbon hub for students and start-up companies to learn, network and prosper.

The University of Derby ranked in the Top 15 for satisfaction with feedback in the Guardian University Guide 2025, and Top 20 for overall assessment and feedback in the National Student Survey 2024.

We have a strong awareness of our environmental impact and we aim to bring sustainability into all aspects of our teaching, research, operational and international activities.

name: University of International Business and Economics
description:
The University of International Business and Economics (UIBE), situated in the northeast of Beijing, was founded in 1951. UIBE is a national key university jointly-sponsored by the Ministry of Education and the Ministry of Commerce, and is the top university in the fields of economics and business.

UIBE pursues to be an outstanding national university and a prestigious international university with its distinct characteristics. After over sixty years’ development, UIBE has already become a multi- disciplinary university specialized in the fields of economics, management, liberal arts, law and science, and competitive in the subjects such as international trade, law, finance, business management and foreign languages. At present, UIBE offers over 50 majors to overseas students for bachelor, master and doctoral study. Among them, about 20 majors can be entirely offered in English.

With a galaxy of talents, UIBE has attracts the best minds and brings up famous personnel generation after generation. Most professors have oversea experience and the strong abilities of teaching and researching, which enable them to rank among the National Talent Cultivation Project.

name: University of Kaiserslautern-Landau(RPTU)
description:
The University of Kaiserslautern-Landau (RPTU) is dedicated to world-class research and teaching and is an enabler of science-driven innovation. We offer excellent study conditions and career opportunities. Our University emerged from joining the Technische Universität Kaiserslautern (TUK, University of Kaiserslautern) and the University in Landau at the beginning 2023. Due to the systematic of THE ranking, we here provide data for the former TUK.

The University has more than more than 20,000 students, 3,000 employees and 300 professors. Those who study, do research and work with us experience a cosmopolitan environment and shape the future. RPTU's research profile focuses on natural and engineering sciences and integrates aspects of planning, social, economic, environmental, and educational sciences. From the broad wealth of our excellent research, seven strategic research fields have been defined. RPTU’s researchers are currently engaged in five collaborative research centers funded by the German Research Foundation (DFG), which are among the most prestigious research programs in Germany.

In our sixteen departments, we offer more than 160 degree programs, all organized in consecutive fully accredited Bachelor's/Master's programs. RPTU is also an expert in teacher education and teacher professional development. In addition, the University places great emphasis on excellent graduate and Ph.D. training. In particular, RPTU offers several international and national Ph.D. programs funded by the German Research Foundation (DFG). Furthermore, RPTU's Distance and Independent Studies Center (DISC) is one of the largest providers of postgraduate distance learning programs in Germany.

A number of top research institutes are located on site, such as the Max Planck Institute for Software Systems, the Fraunhofer Institute for Industrial Mathematics, the Fraunhofer Institute for Experimental Software Engineering, the German Research Center for Artificial Intelligence, and the Leibniz Institute for Composite Materials. All institutes have been initiated by the University.

name: University of Kerbala
description: The University of Kerbala was founded in Kerbala Holy City-Iraq by the ministerial decree no. 15 namely from the Iraqi Ministry of Higher Education and Scientific Research in 2002. It has since grown in size and stature to become one of the most prestigious universities not only in the country but the region as a whole. It is a foremost institution of higher academic and scholarly learning, known for its innovative approach to academic management, human resource development and the pursuit of excellence in research and teaching in varied areas of science, , humanities, medicine and social sciences. The University of Kerbala provides a high quality education for Iraqis as well as international students. The University offers undergraduate studies that meet international standards with quality assurance. Its aim is to provide quality education to our students in all fields of specialties and at every level and to encourage meaningful research programs that not only are relevant to the economic growth and development of the country but also to human welfare and prosperity. Moreover, it aims at engaging in public service at the local, national and international levels by fostering cultural enrichment and providing educational and training opportunities.

name: University of Kufa
description:
The University of Kufa, founded in 1987, has since its inception been a pioneering and innovative force in Iraqi higher education. The University is recognized as one of the leading Iraqi research and teaching  institutes. Today, the University of Kufa has over 26,000 undergraduate and 2,500 postgraduate students enrolled on degree programmes, and 900 faculty members. There are twenty one faculties, each of which constitutes an administrative grouping of departments and other institutes. It has established itself as a regional center of academic and research excellence with a growing international reputation.

The university seeks to provide students with a comprehensive education that inculcates Islamic values while providing a quality secular education that promotes the development  of  the  whole   person - intellectually , spiritually, socially  and physically,  while nurturing individual talents and abilities . As a world class university, research and innovation underpins Kufa’s philosophy of learning. It is committed through its international outreach and collaborations to developing globally experienced and trained leaders who are competent to face the world's  most problematic challenges .

name: University of Management and Technology
description:
University of Management and Technology UMT is a project of Institute of Leadership and Management (ILM) Trust. ILM was established in 1990 by leading educationists, professionals, and industrialists with an aim to enhance the organizational and individual effectiveness.

The University of Management and Technology has evolved into a premier institution of higher learning in the country. Recognized by the Higher Education Commission (HEC) as a “W4” category (highest rank) university, UMT is also the first in the Punjab amongst medium sized universities in the general category.

UMT – now an independent, not-for-profit, private institution of higher learning – received her degree-granting charter first as the Institute of Management and Technology (IMT) in 2002 through an Act of the Assembly of the Punjab. Later, on 16 June 2004, IMT became University of Management and Technology through the passing of a similar Act by the Punjab Assembly. In September 2007, the Higher Education Commission (HEC), Pakistan, upgraded the category of UMT from ‘Category X’/ previous ‘Category B’ to ‘Category W’/ previous ‘Category A’

http://www.umt.edu.pk/

https://www.facebook.com/umtofficial/

https://www.linkedin.com/groups/3177561/profile

https://twitter.com/UMTOfficial

name: University of Miskolc
description:
The University of Miskolc is located in North Hungary, at the foothills of the Bükk Mountains, in the city of Miskolc. The city serves as the center of the Northern Hungarian region and the university is not just a traditional institution of higher education but plays the roles of an important scientific/research and cultural center. It has its own extensive (85 hectares) and attractive campus with on-campus student housing, and excellent sports and recreational facilities (including high-standard athletic fields, soccer grounds, and a great number of tennis courts. All the lecturing and laboratory rooms are equipped to high standards and the spacious workshops include sophisticated technical facilities allowing also pilot-scale experimentation. A high-speed computer network and broadband wifi access are available all over the university buildings, including a large scale central library equipped with abundant computer terminals. The calm and dominantly green campus includes all the facilities required for not just the studies but also for the everyday life of students, it is rarely necessary to use the high capacity and well organized public transport to the city center within 15 minutes reach.

The Faculty of Earth Sciences and Engineering and the Faculty of Materials Science and Engineering share the unique traditions of technical higher education started in 1735 - recognized as the first in the World - at the predecessor of the institution. The largest Faculty is that of Mechanical Engineering and Informatics, established in 1949 at the current location of the university. Other faculties have been established in the past few decades to offer high scale education and research also in the fields of social sciences (law, economics), humanities, health care, and music. This complexity offered at the integral campus gives a special color and flavor to the University of Miskolc.

Study programs are available at bachelor (6-7 semesters), master (4 semesters), and doctoral (4 years) levels. Most of the postgraduate courses in the fields of technical and social sciences and also in humanities are offered also in English. The courses are based on strong theoretical foundations and developed to serve the practical applications for current and future needs. Lecturing and practice are well balanced, and courses are designed to implement modern methodologies.

The international student body of the university, representing some 50 countries, is increasing year by year. They are most welcome and taken care of by our International Office.  All new international students are offered on-campus dormitory accommodation, but in case of special needs, alternative solutions are assisted by eager and helpful office staff. Special guidance and mentoring are offered by a voluntary organization of our Hungarian students supervised also by our staff.

One special feature of the university is its student traditions, practiced in their professional communities handed down from the university’s origins of almost 3 centuries ago. National and international students are offered the chance to actively take part in all the research projects run by the institutes and departments in all the specialized fields. Scientific conferences are regularly organized for the best-performing students, who can take part in a variety of international competitions too, e.g. in computer science, building electric and special formula racing cars or robots, carry out mock trials and devise business plans.

Details of the institutional structure, courses, and international research projects are available in English at the website: www.uni-miskolc.hu.

name: University of Mosul
description:
University of Mosul is a public university located in Iraq - Mosul. The University was established in 1967. The university includes 24 colleges, 7 research centers, 6 consulting offices, 5 Hospitals & Clinics, few museums, a number of directorates, technical and administrative units. There are more than 4000 academic lecturers in university, distributed to sciences and humanities colleges and centers throughout the university. The area of the University is estimated at more than 270 hectares distributed over three areas within Mosul. The University provides advanced programs for higher education in various disciplines at all levels in accordance with high standards aimed at presenting more qualified graduates who contribute to the development of the society economically and socially. In addition, the university shows a commitment to ethical and professional values, creates a stimulating environment for learning and intellectual creativity, supports the human rights, employs technology optimally, and pursues creative research that contributes to building a knowledge society. The University aims to achieve leadership and excellence in the fields of teaching and learning, knowledge production and dissemination, and community service, to reach an advanced position among Iraqi, Arab and international universities.

The University of Mosul aims at providing advanced programs for higher education in various disciplines, at all levels, in accordance with high standards, aimed at producing qualified and competent graduates who contribute to the development of society with regards to knowledge, the economy and social standards. Our graduates are committed to spiritual, moral and professional values, trained in creating an environment conducive to learning and intellectual creativity, supporting human rights, preserving the environment, optimising the use of technology, providing academic freedom, and seeking creative research that contributes to building knowledge and society.

name: University of North Carolina at Greensboro
description:
The institution that is now The University of North Carolina at Greensboro was chartered in 1891 to provide higher education for women. Formerly The Women's College, and one of the three original institutions of The Consolidated University of North Carolina, UNCG has been highly regarded now for over one hundred years for both its strong liberal arts tradition and its excellent professional preparation for selected careers. In 1963, it became a doctoral-granting, coeducational university, and is now classified as a research university (high research activity) by the Carnegie Foundation.

UNCG is a member of the National Association of State Universities and Land Grant Colleges (NASULGC) and the American Association of Colleges and Universities (AASCU). In Fall 2008, the student body of UNCG was comprised of approximately 16,703 men and women, including 13,453 undergraduates and 3,250 graduate students. The Division of Continual Learning has grown to a total enrollment in academic credit courses of 771. Students from all 50 states and 56 foreign countries were represented in the student body.

Undergraduate minority enrollment was 35%, including 21.6% African-American students. Approximately 67% of UNCG students received some type of financial aid. Among the 1,055 faculty members are nationally known scholars whose research and creative work regularly contribute new knowledge to their fields; 80.7% of full-time faculty hold terminal degrees in their disciplines. The estimated ratio of students to faculty was 16 to 1 in fall 2008. UNCG faculty members remain committed to excellence in teaching, research, and public service, and are easily accessible to students through an advisory system and on an informal basis.

name: University of Ostrava
description: The University of Ostrava is a dynamic educational institution with a wide range of academic opportunities within the humanities and fine arts, social and natural sciences, and health and education fields. Our six faculties are filled with leading figures in their respective fields, who are not only scientists, but also inspirational and open-minded personalities with a vivid sense of creativity. The University of Ostrava serves nearly 10,000 students with a strongly individual approach and proactively adapts to the needs of society and the labor market. In addition to education and research, our university is actively involved in the community; the faculties, student organizations and scientific institutes promote hundreds of public events a year including, open workshops, lectures, and seminars, as well as experiential events, scientific adventures, international gatherings, art exhibitions, concerts, and theatre plays. Once known as the "Steel Heart of Czechoslovakia", our industrial heritage makes for a dramatic backdrop in which to study. The city of our university's namesake has transformed into a modern and vibrant place with our campus spread throughout the historical city center providing students a stimulating environment to contemplate the arts and sciences.

name: University of Pannonia
description: The University of Pannonia performs research and R&D activities and offers programmes in the main areas of engineering, economics, information technology, humanities and agricultural sciences. Prestigious international projects provide researchers' and students' mobility, and also contribute to the quality of the programmes in these areas. In all activities, including international projects, the university seriously takes into account sustainability.

name: University of Peradeniya
description:
The University ofPeradeniya located 110km from Colombo was established in Colombo on 1st July1942,  moved to Peradeniya in 1952. Thehistory of its evolution as the oldest and the largest university in thecountry passed through the following stages: University ofCeylon (1942 - 1952), University of Ceylon, Peradeniya (1952 - 1972), Universityof Sri Lanka, Peradeniya Campus (1972 -1978) , University of Peradeniya (Since1978).

The University currentlycomprises of  nine faculties; namely facultiesof Agriculture, Allied Health Sciences, Arts, Dental Sciences, Engineering,Management, Medicine, Science and Veterinary Medicine & Animal Sciences, andfour postgraduate institutes; namely Postgraduate Institutes of, Agriculture(PGIA), Humanities and Social Sciences (PGIHS) and Science (PGIS) and PostgraduateSchool of Medicine (PGSM).  We have over12,500 undergraduates and around 8,500 postgraduate students (around 1150 in respectivefaculties and around 7350 in postgraduate institutes). At this moment we have21 residential halls for undergraduates with four more coming up at the end ofthe year with a view to provide 100% accommodation to undergraduates.

The University has awell-equipped library network to support teaching, learning and research, witha central library and seven satellite libraries, with  over 850,000 books and other readingmaterials.

name: University of Petra
description: Located in West of Amman, the University of Petra is home to eight faculties on a friendly campus, housing more than seven thousand undergraduate and graduate students in the faculties of Arts and Sciences, Administrative & Financial Sciences, Pharmacy & Medical Sciences, Information Technology, Architecture & Design, Law, Mass Communication, and Engineering. The University is a hub for creating knowledge through research, developing skills, applying knowledge to new technologies, and technology transfer. The university has a friendly-use campus to unleash students' minds to new horizons of thought, philosophy, and logic. It provides an intriguing environment of freedom of thought, inquiry, interactive and blended learning, and R&D facilities. UOP is keen in developing an outreach program for community development and engaging in regional and international science for bridging with other scientists, journals, and symposia to bring science to solve social problems, open new employment opportunities, and eradicate poverty. UOP achieved ABET, ACPE, ASIC, ASIIN, ISO 9001:2015, and Quality Assurance Certificate from AQACHI. Furthermore, it has been ranked as one of the top universities in Jordan by QS, THE Impact, U-multirank, Green Metric, Webometrics, RUR, and UniRank.

name: University of Primorska
description: In the field of education, the University of Primorska aims to promote and further strengthen the diversity, internationalisation, quality and social dimension of study programmes carried by the university and, at the same time, to support the development of the culture of mutual cooperation and integration between its members. Innovative study programmes at all three cycles of study are offered in the study areas of: teacher training and education science, humanities, social and behavioural science, business and administration, law, life sciences, mathematics and statistics, computing, engineering and engineering trades, agriculture, forestry and fishery, health and personal services. Graduates acquire a diploma which includes Diploma Supplement and with it also a professional or academic title. The Diploma Supplement is published in Slovene language and one of the official languages of the European Union.

name: University of Rijeka
description:
The University of Rijeka was founded in 1973. The state-funded university is located in the city of Rijeka with faculties in cities throughout the regions of Istria, Lika and Primorje.The university has around 18,000 students. Directly controlled by the Ministry of Science, Education and Sport, the University of Rijeka has eleven faculties, one art academy and four departments, offering courses at undergraduate and postgraduate level and both full and part-time programs. Most of the tuition is carried out in Croatian, though some courses can also be offered in English, Hungarian, Italian and German. Faculties are:

Departments are:

The university has established ties with many other institutions throughout Europe, with an ultimate goal to have agreements with all of the Top 500.Notable alumni include: Jakov Kitarović, husband of Kolinda Grabar-Kitarović, the former President of the Republic of Croatia; Nina Broznić, cross country skier; and Fr. Zlatko Sudac, Roman Catholic diocesan priest for the diocese of Krk, Croatia.

name: University of San Diego
description:
Ranked among the world's top 1,000 universities in the QS World University Rankings 2019, the University of San Diego (USD) was initially established in 1949. A private Roman Catholic institution, USD offers teaching across seven different academic colleges. Campus is located to the north of downtown San Diego, California and the Pacific Ocean is visible from campus. Students here can enjoy the gorgeous Californian weather and are ideally located for trips to other Californian cities such as Los Angeles or Mexico, which is a short drive away.

Over 8,000 students are enrolled at the University of San Diego, with approximately 5,741 studying at undergraduate level. All students at the institution will have experienced a peculiar campus tradition known as the 'community scream'. At midnight before the first day of final exams, students gather on campus to collectively scream. This is supposed to bring good luck and passing grades to all those who participate.

name: University of Sarajevo
description:
Since its founding in 1949, the University of Sarajevo is oriented towards international cooperation, building bridges between cultures, and establishing partnerships with universities from all over the world. The University of Sarajevo is open to anyone who wishes to contribute, with relevant intellectual qualities, to participate in develop­ment of education and research, respecting the principles of the University autonomy and academic freedom of individual expression and affirmation of skills and qualities. The orientation of the University of Sarajevo is the integration into the world academic processes and continuous efforts towards the improvement of our international reputation. Through its teaching and research, the University of Sarajevo is responsible to educate competent, creative and internationally recognizable professionals in all areas of interest to Bosnia and Herzegovina, in order to be able to provide quality professional services in modern society in the economic, political and cultural context of Europe and the world.

This public institution offers study and research opportunities at 22 Faculties, 3 Academies, 5 Centres, 5 Institutes, with National and University Library, Gazi Husrevbey Library, National Museum of Bosnia and Herzegovina, Student Parliament, with over 100 study programmes and over 200 departments. Today, having around 34,000 enrolled students, it ranks among the largest universities in the region.

name: University of Silesia in Katowice
description:
The University of Silesia in Katowice is accredited to offer over80 full-time and part-time programmes, including unique programmes such as the following: Aquamatics - Interdisciplinary Management of Water Environments, International Studies in Political Science and Diplomacy, Music in Multimedia, Biophysics and Medical Physics.

The programmes offer a total of over200 specialisations, including Biomedical Solutions Designer, Molecular Biophysics, Geophysics, Nanophysics and Mesoscopic Materials, Geoecology and New Media Journalism.

The University regularly upgrades its didactic offer by launching new programmes which reflect the needs of the labour market. The University has almost22,000 intramural and extramural studentsat theBA, MA, postgraduate and Ph.D. level, following115 undergraduate and postgraduate programmes subdivided into over 200 specializations. All courses are recognized by the ECTS, which facilitates international student exchange.

The University of Silesia also offers education for doctoral students in more than20 disciplinesin the fields of humanities, theology, art, social sciences, exact and natural sciences as well as engineering and technical sciences. The education is interdisciplinary and specialized. The University provides doctoral students with opportunities to conduct interesting and innovative research projects. Education is organized in the Doctoral School and the International Environmental Doctoral School associated with the Centre for Polar Studies at the University of Silesia in Katowice. All doctoral students conduct research and receive scholarship. Doctoral education is free of charge.

name: University of Texas El Paso
description:
The University of Texas, El Paso (UTEP) is notable for having a sizable Mexican-American student population. Only one other university in the United States is bigger than UTEP and has a majority Mexican-American student body. A reported 80 percent of students at UTEP are classified as Mexican-American.

Established in 1914, UTEP started life as a school focused on mining engineering and metallurgy. Since then, the university has expanded focus to cover 74 undergraduate and 76 postgraduate degrees, although a hint of its origins can be found in UTEP’s nickname. Its students and sports teams are known as the ‘Miners’, and a large ‘M’ painted by students in the 1920s can still be seen on campus today, close to the Sun Bowl sports stadium.

UTEP’s campus is particularly striking, with many buildings constructed in the style of Bhutanese dzongs. The massive sloping walls and overhanging roofs which are a feature of this type of construction are rarely seen outside of Tibet or Bhutan, and their presence on UTEP’s campus can be traced to the wife of the school’s first dean. After a fire in 1916 destroyed most of the original campus buildings, Kathleen Worrell suggested the new buildings follow a design she had seen in an issue of National Geographic.

name: Universität Siegen
description:
This modern high-profile university has international orientation and hosts more than 19.000 students and more than 11% come from other countries.  The University of Siegen is guided by international cooperation and its central principle: “Creating a humane future”.

Today the University of Siegen The University of Siegen offers a 108 degree programs across four different faculties. The wide range of research activities includes basic and applied research across all faculties. From accounting to visual computing, University of Siegen offers a broad choice of subjects. The university is committed to interdisciplinary teaching and research as well as paying special attention to students. Being a modern university, it offers a comprehensive academic program which pays tribute to the heritage of its home region.

name: Ibn Tofail University
description:
Ibn tofail University is created by dahir 1.89.144 of 22 Rabiae 1st, 1410 (October 23rd, 1989), it is located in the center of the region of Rabat-Salé-Kenitra which is well known for being one of the richest regions of Morocco, especially for its assets in economic growth areas (agriculture, food, environment, industry, technology, etc…).

Given its potentials for such economic development, Ibn Tofail University will be required to play a leading part in sustaining these sectors and high value-added segments.

Faculties consists of the faculty of arts and humanities (1985), the faculty of sciences (1985) and the faculty of law, economic and social sciences (1991).There is also a National School of Business and Management (2005), a National school of Applied Sciences (2008), a graduate school of technology (2017), a National Higher School of Chemistry (2019), and a Higher School of Education and Training (2019).

Ibn tofail University include eight common services:

All the institutions within the University are equipped with excellent facilities: auditoriums, laboratories, meeting rooms, multimedia equipment rooms, video conferencing, etc…Through its structure, Ibn Tofail University conducts an industrious policy of opening into its socio-economic environment to develop particularly:

name: Université Mohammed V de Rabat
description: Mohammed V University in a university located in Rabat, Morocco and was founded in 1957. The university offers both undergraduate and postgraduate programs and was formed by merging two institutions:  Mohammed V University at Agdal and Mohammed V University at Souissi. Currently, the university has two different campuses.

name: Université de Limoges
description:
The French city of Limoges is located towards the center of the country, in the former Limousin region. As well as being known for its university, the city is also famous for its oak barrels (used in wine production around the world) and its 19th-century porcelain.

The University of Limoges is home to over 16,000 students and offers undergraduate, postgraduate and doctoral degrees. Teaching at the university is split across five main departments: Law and Economics; Literature and Humanities; Medicine; Pharmacy; and Sciences and Technology.

Although the university was only established in the late 1960s, it can trace its tradition of teaching and research back to the Middle Ages, when the Abbaye Saint-Martial de Limoges - a Benedictine abbey - was located in the city. Unfortunately, the abbey’s teaching was suppressed by the French Revolution in 1891.

While the university has a strong research focus, arguably its most famous graduate is the former footballer and World Cup winner Zinedine Zidane, who studied here before going to work for Spanish football club Real Madrid.

name: Université de Sousse
Université Toulouse - Jean Jaurès
description:
Université Toulouse - Jean Jaurès   was created early 13 century and aside from its long established tradition of high calibre education, the university is also famous because it accommodates prestigious humanists such as Michel Servert, Étienne Dolet, Michel de l?Hopital, Rabelais and probably Montaigne.  In 1808, it become an imperial University and consisted of the faculties of Catholic and Protestant Theology, letters, law, Sciences and a medical school.  In the twentieth century, the university reached its full development and moved to the new district of Mirail and the university was named after the district. While maintaining its long heritage, the University of Toulouse offers new contents and develops new courses in order to move with the changing nature of the international education system.

The university currently provides vocational training for adults and developed a partnership with many institutions around the world. Presently, the university takes part in the great reform organized the State and is un the process of adopting new structures of operations that includes to further add more courses to their curriculum, to offer students a more clear and coherent formation and to increase the use of technology across the campuses.  Faithful to its humanistic tradition, the University of Toulouse provides a dynamic education system in the fields of Letters, Arts, Languages, Social sciences and Sciences.    In order to respond to the new demands of the world today, the university provided extended courses in various languages such as regional languages i.e. Basque, Catalan, European languages, languages of the Mediterranean region, Latin American languages and finally oriental languages.

Furthermore, the university takes part in the great cultural projects on a worldwide scale through its exchange programs and permanently work to promote the exchange of people and ideas. Each year, a hundred teachers and foreign researchers are accommodated at the University of Toulouse and more than 2000 foreign students are registered, including nearly 800 Europeans. The Research centre was inaugurated in September 1994 and designed to implement the scientific policy of the University in the field of the Letters, Languages and Social sciences.  Thirty-two teams were put in place with all the services of support to research and doctorate studies.

name: Université de Tunis
description: Located in the Tunisian city of Tunis, Tunis University celebrated its 60th year of existence in 2020. A member of the Mediterranean University Union, the university has strong connections with other Francophone institutions. Teaching at the university is split into around 16 institutions, including a business school, a preparatory engineering institute and several higher institutes in various subjects such as music and fine arts. Approximately 28,000 students are enrolled at the university. More information about admissions can be found on their official website.

name: Western Michigan University
description:
Western Michigan University is a national research university enrolling nearly 24,000 students from across the United States and 100 other countries. Founded in 1903, it is a learner-centered, discovery-driven and globally engaged public university that stands out among America’s more than 4,600 higher education institutions.  The University offers 256 degree programs including bachelor, master, doctoral and ESL. These programs are offered through seven degree-granting colleges: Arts and Sciences, Aviation, Education and Human Development, Engineering and Applied Sciences, Fine Arts, Haworth College of Business, and Health and Human Services.  Many programs rank among the top of their kind in the country, giving WMU a national or international reputation as one of the best places to study in fields as varied as aviation flight science, creative writing, engineering management technology, evaluation, experimental atomic physics, geology, integrated supply management, jazz studies, medieval studies, occupational therapy, paper engineering, psychology, sales and business marketing, and speech pathology.  Whenever possible, instruction is designed so graduating students are ready to immediately add value to their employers. Plus, the University’s business-industry partnerships and exchange agreements with organizations around the globe provide countless opportunities for students to obtain internships, conduct research, gain field experience and study abroad.

Learn more about Western Michigan University at https://wmich.edu/

name: Yessenov University
description:
Located in the Caspian region, Yessenov University is one of the youngest University in Kazakhstan with a variety of bachelors, MS, MA programs, PhD available to study, covering a range of subjects, including oil and gas, accounting, communications and management, finance, international relation, tourism, pedagogy. Yessenov University believes that the main purpose of University is orientation on the fulfilling of demands and needs of teachers and students.

With Kazakh, Russian and English degree programs, students can learn French, Farsi,  Turkish languages in parallel to their major studies, while enjoying the many benefits of living in Aktau, one of the greatest safest, cleanest, most hospitable city in Kazakhstan.

In adopting a internalization approach, the University has established close partnerships with Azerbaijan Technical University, Gubkin Russian State University of Oil and Gas,   Beykent University (Turkey), University of Gabrovo (Bulgaria) and others, which lend to bilateral exchange of expertise and research, students and stuff academic mobility.

One of the unique program in Central Asia region is presented in Yessenov University Maritime academy, where student can get both civil profession and military degree.

Nowadays University host more than 15 % of international students from 6 countries, they live in the new modern dormitory and during the studying the academic staff give them social and psychological support.

Follow Yssenov University on Facebook, Instagram, Twitter and YouTube.

name: Universitas Negeri Yogyakarta
description:
Founded in 1964, Yogyakarta State University (YSU), formerly known as Yogyakarta Institute of Teacher Education and Educational Sciences, is a public university located in Yogyakarta, Indonesia. The main campus of YSU, occupied in Karangmalang campus, covers 514.562 m2 of land and becomes one of the leading universities in educational fields. It also has three other campuses in Yogyakarta, including UPP 1 (Mandala campus), UPP 2 (Bantul campus), and UPP 3 (Wates campus).

This university has over 32,625 students organized by seven faculties and school, including Faculty of Education, Faculty of Mathematics and Natural Sciences, Faculty of Languages and Arts, Faculty of Social Sciences and Economics, Faculty of Engineering, Faculty of Sport Sciences, and graduated school. In 2019, there are 67 undergraduate, 30 Master’s, and 6 doctoral programs.  As one of the respectable universities in Indonesia, YSU has ranked 11th over more than 4000 universities in Indonesia. UNY always leads to focus and improves learning, teaching, and research activities by offering outstanding facilities and services, including digital library, sport centre,  counseling centre, the health care centre, convention hall and performance stages, post office, physical therapy clinic, and banking services.

name: Zagazig University
description:
Zagazig University is one of the largest governmental universities in Egypt with approximately 7000 faculty members and more than 120000 students enrolled in 24 academic colleges and institutions. Since its establishment in 1974, Zagazig University (ZU) strives to remain at the forefront of research, teaching, and professional education. The university community is widely known for its leadership in teaching, research and outreach and for instilling in its students the core values of excellence, integrity, leadership, loyalty, respect and selfless service. All of ZU degrees are accredited by the Supreme Council of Universities in Egypt and many of its degrees are accredited by the National Authority for Quality Assurance and Assessment of Education (NAQAAE) in Egypt. Zagazig University contains 24 academic colleges and institutions as shown below:

name: Zarqa University (ZU)
description:
arqa University (ZU) was founded in 1994 in a strategic location to the east of Zarqa City, just six kilometres away, to be the first private university in Zarqa Governorate, with an area that reached three hundred and fifty acres. The University aims at going in parallel lines with the objectives and the strategies of public and private Jordanian universities, It also supports the different goals of Jordanian higher education system and meets the scientific, social, economic, cultural and human needs.

The University started with six colleges that comprised one hundred and fifty students enrolled in twenty majors. In the academic year of 2017/2018, the number of students has increased to reach about eight thousand students distributed on thirteen colleges, including seven humanities faculties and six scientific faculties. The University comprises forty four undergraduate majors, and postgraduate programs in English Language and Literature, Accounting, Computer Science, Mathematics, Marketing, Software Engineering, Business Administration, Intellectual Property and Islamic Banking. It also includes three deanships; Deanship of Scientific Research, Student Affairs and Evening Studies, in addition to five centers: Islamic Cultural Centre, Computer Centre , Language Centre , Centre of Continuing Education and Community Service ,E-learning Centre and Energy Research Center. Other administrative departments; such as the Admission and Registration Department, Library and the Development and Quality Assurance Unit.

Believing in its scientific; practical and humanitarian mission, the university seeks to achieve excellence and leadership through providing the community with modern academic majors that meet its needs for developing its institutions, employing a group of dedicated experts and scholars in their areas and polarizing a large number of non Jordanian students from sixty Arab and foreign nationalities.

The University has been chosen as a host of many well known scientific conferences and associations such as Arab conference on Information Technology "ACIT" since 2000, in addition to the General Secretariat of the Association of Colleges of Computers and Information, emanating from the Arab Universities Union since 2007, which publishes the International Arab Journal of Information Technology (IAJIT), which is an indexed journal by Thompson (ISI), as well as the General Secretariat of the International Arab Conference on Quality Assurance in Higher Education (IACQA) since 2011, and the Association of Professors of English and Translation at Arab Universities (APETAU) since 2016, which publishes the International Journal of Arabic and English Studies. The University also helps students financially, as it offers a range of discounts, grants, and exemptions from tuition fees, up to 70% for many specializations.

Zarqa Journal for Research and Studies in Humanities is the main Journal of the University. It Started in 1999, and is published quarterly by the Deanship of Scientific Research. The journal publishes in Arabic and English, and is internationally indexed in Ulrich’s Database.

The University was awarded the (ISO) certificate in 2009, which is accomplished through careful planning between the Board of Directors, the Board of Trustees, and the University Administration, who work as one team. It also obtained the Crown International Quality Certificate from UK in 2015

name: Akdeniz Üniversitesi
description: Akdeniz University was founded in 1982 in Antalya, and incorporated a number of higher education institutions in the West Mediterranean region of Turkey. In 1992 the units of Akdeniz University which were located in Isparta were transferred to Süleyman Demirel University, and in 2006 the units in Burdur were transferred to Mehmet Akif Ersoy University. From its foundation to the present day, Akdeniz University has been responsible for vital and pioneering work in the fields of education, research, development, and service to society, resulting in a series of notable successes at both the national and international level which have made the name of our university synonymous with advances in health, social and natural sciences, as well as progress in the artistic and educational world. Today, Akdeniz University has 39 units, including 16 faculties, 7 institutes, 4 schools, 1 conservatory and 11 vocational schools.

name: American International University-Bangladesh (AIUB)
description:
An independent private university, the American International University-Bangladesh (AIUB) was established in 1994 by its Founder Chairman, the Late Dr. Anwarul Abedin, in accordance with the Private University Act of 1992 and which has approval of the Government and the University Grants Commission (UGC) of Bangladesh. Since its inception, AIUB has been committed to provide, maintain, and enhance an educational environment that is conducive to learning, not only for those who come to learn but also for those who impart it. For over a decade, the institution offers an enriching undergraduate and graduate experience, with the right combination of all the essential components required for attaining excellence in learning. The infrastructural and research facilities, along with the support of competent and compassionate faculty, make AIUB a truly dynamic learning environment, where tomorrow’s leaders are created. With over 10,000 students currently pursuing their dreams, following the footsteps of nearly 33,000 graduates before them, AIUB ensure high standard and excellence in education that will make them a force to be reckoned and propel them towards the future.

Vision

American International University-Bangladesh continuously transforms the students to become innovative and globally competitive with excellent, state-of-the-art and academic knowledge and skills nurturing their full potentials not only as future leaders in their respective fields of endeavor, but also as unique contributors to the society.

Mission

American International University-Bangladesh is committed to provide quality and excellent academic programs responsive to the emerging global challenges. The university is dedicated to produce and foster competent world class graduates imbued with strong sense of ethical values ready to face the competitive world of business, science, technology, engineering and social sciences.

Quality Policy

American International University-Bangladesh adheres to quality in conformity with the prescribed national, international, professional and academic standards of quality and excellence. The university is committed to translate its academic programs and projects into actions propagating the best practices and assuring the quality of learning opportunities. The students being the most valued stakeholders are the central focus of the university and are provided with utmost care and attention to meet their primordial needs and future career success. In view of this commitment, the university shall exert best efforts to harmonize its actions through collaboration, cooperation and consultation with every unit and components of the university.

Linkage & Networking

Web: www.aiub.edu

Email:[email protected]

name: Anadolu University
description:
Eskişehir Academy of Economic and Commercial Sciences, founded in 1958, formed the basis of Anadolu University. The Academy was replaced by Anadolu University in 1982, which has gained a well-deserved place as a modern, dynamic and innovative institution among the largest universities not only in Turkey, but also in the world. Situated in the center of Eskişehir, which is well-known as a city of science, culture and youth, its campus houses 12 faculties (undergraduate level) - three of which offer distance education, 3 applied schools – one of which is of music and drama, 2 vocational schools (associate level), 6 graduate schools – four of which are graduate and postgraduate level, and 30 research centers.

Anadolu University has been a pioneering institution on many fronts. Most important of these is the success of implementing the distance education system. Today, the total number of students of the three distance education faculties is over 2 million. The success in the development of this system has been taken as a model by many institutions in various countries.

In its departments equipped with cutting-edge technology, Anadolu University with its faculty who strive to be the best in their field and devote all of their time to their students have been working hard to prepare their students to be the best in its creative and dynamic learning settings.

On its safe and modern campus, a student has access to almost all of the facilities that they might need. The main library, where students can reach more than 315.000 print resources as well as many e-resources, is open for 24/7, including holidays. Additionally, free soup/tea/coffee is offered to students between 00:00 PM-01:00 AM in the library area. In the main library, with an area of 12.330 m2, students have the opportunity to study in the environments that are appropriate for their study style. Students can enjoy the cultural and artistic activities in the theatre, concert and exhibition halls on Yunus Emre campus. Moreover, students can spend their free time efficiently while having the opportunities to join talks and activities with artists, and do any kind of sport in the semi-olympic swimming pool, in gyms at international standards, tennis courts, and green pitches on the campuses. The university serves breakfast, lunch and dinner for students as well.

We take pride in our university because it follows technological and scientific developments, educates proactive individuals who will shape the future, and focuses on lifelong learning with an endeavor to include the entire  population in the process of learning by embracing the world.

name: Aswan University
description:
Aswan University branch was established in 1974 affiliated to Assuit University and the study was begun in it in October 1973-1974 in faculty of Education.

• The first bachelor degree was granted in 1978.

• The registration for Master degree in Science began in the academic year 1977-1978.

• The registration for PHD degree began in the academic year 1977-1978.

• In 1995 a presidential decree no.23 for 1995 was issued to establish South Valley University, and then university branch became affiliated to South Valley University.

• Other faculties were established (faculty of Arts- faculty of Social Work- faculty of Engineering).

• In 2012, Aswan university was established as a dependence university according to the presidential decree no.311 in 11-6-2013

• The university includes 15 faculties (faculty of Arts- faculty of Education-faculty of Social Work- faculty of Engineering- faculty of Energy Engineering- faculty of Veterinary Medicine- faculty of Agriculture- faculty of Nursing- faculty of Languages and Translation- faculty of Medicine- faculty of fishes and fisheries Technology- faculty of Commerce- faculty of Archaeology- faculty of Specific Education).

• The main campus is located in Sahary city- airport road. Aswan University is distinct because it serves a larger geographical scale of Egypt.

name: Atma Jaya Catholic University of Indonesia
description:
The idea of establishing a catholic university in Indonesia was proposed at a meeting between bishops of Java held in Jakarta on 1st June 1952. To respond to this idea, the Atma Jaya Foundation was formed by a group of young catholic intellectuals on 1st June 1960 and this foundation established a catholic university named Universitas Katolik Indonesia Atma Jaya (Atma Jaya Catholic University). Among these young catholic intellectuals were: Ir. J.P.Cho, Drs. Lo Siang Hien-Ginting, Drs. Goei Tjong Tik, I.J. Kasimo, J.B. Legiman S.H., Drs. F.X. Seda, Dr. Pang Lay Kim, Ir. Tan Bian Seng, Dr. Anton Moeliono, St. Munadjat Danusaputro S.H., Drs. J.F. Tan, and Drs. Ben Mang-Reng Say.

At its early years, Unika Atma Jaya was supported by the Ursuline sisters. They kindly lent the university their classrooms in Ursuline school complex on Jalan Lapangan Banteng Utara and in Santa Theresia complex in Menteng. Since 1967, Atma Jaya has gradually occupied a permanent campus on the Jalan Sudirman campus well known as the Semanggi Campus. The Faculty of Medicine, the Atma Jaya hospital and the Atma Jaya funeral home occupy the Pluit Campus in North Jakarta.

name: Belarusian State University of Informatics and Radioelectronics
description:
The Belarusian State University of Informatics and Radioelectronics (BSUIR) was founded in 1964. BSUIR is the industry-leading educational establishment and a basic CIS organisation for higher education in computer science and radioelectronics.

BSUIR has 8 faculties: Computer Systems and Networks, Computer-Aided Design, Engineering and Economics, Information Technologies and Control, Radioengineering and Electronics,  Information Security , Military, Pre-University Preparation and Occupational Guidance.

BSUIR offers a range of programs taught entirely in English.

Among academic and research staff are 2 members and 2 corresponding members of the National Academy of Sciences of Belarus, over 500 PhDs.

Key areas of training and researching in BSUIR include Computer Engineering, Software Engineering and Technologies, Cyber Security and Information Security, Electronic Economy and Marketing, Artificial Intelligence, Radioelectronics and Radioinformatics, Infocommunication Technologies, Nanotechnology and Nanoengineering, Big DATA, Internet of Things, Cloud Computing, Medical Electronics, Game Design.

There are 42 scientific laboratories and centres in BSUIR.

The university has 12 (17 centers are listed on bsuir.by) educational centers of the worlds leading companies, where students receive additional training with certification to work with the latest equipment in the IT industry. 45 educational and scientific laboratories have been created on the basis of BSUIR together with industrial enterprises and IT companies.

BSUIR maintains strong partnerships with 168 universities and scientific organizations from 40 countries. About 1000 international students from 40 countries study in BSUIR.

The university aims are to offer educational programs in which students will be interested and to ensure that graduates are competitive and in demand in the labor market.

name: Benha University - Egypt
description:
BU has about 4506 faculty and staff members serving about 127505 students. Because of its reputation, BU is increasingly attracting more international students from the Arab countries. Recently, BU exerted great efforts to raise the meaning of internationalization. BU is collaborating with the UK universities through the British Council institution.

BU has 15 colleges; five of them (Medicine, Veterinary Medicine, Engineering, Science, and Agriculture) are equipped with good research laboratories and instruments; and are engaged in active research at both the national and international levels.

name: CHRIST (Deemed to be University), Bengaluru
description:
CHRIST (Deemed to be University), began as Christ College in 1969 offering undergraduate programmes in Sciences, Humanities, Social Sciences and Commence. From 1992 it began offering masters programmes in Social Sciences and Sciences, and Management. It was the first Institution in Karnataka and one of first 14 in India to be accredited by NAAC in 1997. It also became the first college in Karnataka to be granted Autonomous status by UGC in 2004. It was the first Institution in South India to be re accredited with NAAC A+ Grade in 2005. In 2006 it was accorded the College with Potential for Excellence status by UGC. Based on the quality of academics at the Institution, past performance, and future potential, the Ministry of Human Resources Development, Government of India conferred the status of Deemed to be University   on the Institution vide Notification No. F. 9-34/2007-U.3(A) dated 22 July 2008.

Primarily a liberal arts Institution, CHRIST (Deemed to be University) offers 53 Bachelor, 53 Master, 19 MPhil and 23 Doctoral programmes in Humanities, Social Sciences, Sciences, Commerce, Management, Law, Engineering, Architecture and Education to about 22793 students from all the states and union territories of India and 58 other countries.  The University publishes six peer-reviewed research journals and has published more than 300 books in Kannada and English.

Apart from being ranked well since 2007 in almost all higher education raking surveys, the University has also been ranked 301+ in the Times Higher Education University Impact Ranking 2019. In the raking it is grouped in 101–200th for Quality Education and 201–300th for Gender Equity, globally.

With ‘Excellence and Service’ as the Vision, the University is actively involved in community development through student involvement. The University has slum and rural development projects with a focus on women and children in the city of Bangalore, in the states of Karnataka, Kerala, Maharashtra and Chhattisgarh directly benefiting over 10,000 families. The students and staff of the University sponsor the primary education of over 900 students in the slums of Bangalore annually through voluntary contribution

name: Chaoyang University of Technology
description:
Chaoyang
University of Technology (CYUT) was founded in 1994. Its vision is to educe for
excellence among disciplines. Since the university’s establishment, the
principle “diligence, character and action” strives to foster students’ core
abilities through the cultivation of being dedicated, courteous, responsible,
harmonious, and confident. At the same time, CYUT stays concurrent with industry
technological advances, standards, expertise, and self-learning capabilities.
This ensures students are trained to meet their professional needs. CYUT
comprises 6 colleges and 24 departments, offering 23 master\'s programs and 5
doctoral programs. The current number of students enrolled is about 16,000,
including 1,400 graduate students. CYUT’s excellent teaching and
research performances have received recognition nationwide.

(1)
Partnership Opportunities: Research Centers. CYUT has five globally
competitive research centers: 1.) Chaoyang Agro-Tech Center, 2.) Center of
Non-Destructive Testing (CNDT), 3.) Research
and Development Center for Sustainability of Environmental Resources , 4.) R&D Center of AI (Automatic to Intelligent) Smart Industrial
Technology, and 5.) Research Center of Holistic Development for Young Children.

(2)
Academic Achievements: CYUT has endeavored to connect with many institutions through
each of the continents around the world towards globalization. In recent years,
CYUT has gained considerable
recognition in some of the renowned international university rankings.

1.  QS 2025  World University Rankings: 1201-1400

2.  THE
2025 World University Rankings ranked as 1201-1500

3. 
THE 2024 business and economics as 601~800

4.  THE 2024 Computer Science ranked as 801+

5.  THE 2024 Engineering and Technology Rankings ranked as 1001+

6.   Ranked
in  Best University Ranking 2024-2025 of U.S. News & World Report

In
addition, CYUT has won USR related awards in the past three years as follows:

1.  THE 2024 World University
Impact Ranking. CYUT ranked at 601~800. It has been on the world ranking for four consecutive years.

2.  QS 2024  World University Rankings: Sustainability

3.  From 2020 to 2024, CYUT won
the National USR University Citizenship Award. Its ranking is among private
vocational institutions.

4.  In the 2023 World Green
Energy University Competition, CYUT ranked 26th in the world and has been
ranked among the top 100 in the world for 7 consecutive years.

With
respect to green bio-technology, its application to Special Chemical Production
and Testing at the Department of Applied Chemistry was awarded 2015 Excellent
Academic Award from Workforce Development Agency, Ministry of Labor in Taiwan.

Six
departments are accredited by the Institute of Engineering Education
Taiwan (IEET), including Construction Engineering, Industrial Engineering
and Management, Environmental Engineering and Management, Computer Science and
Information Engineering, Information and Communication Engineering, and
Landscape and Urban Design.

(3) The Innovation and
Incubation (  World
Number Two ) Office of Industry-Academia
Collaboration (IAC) is posited as a unit for cooperation with the industry at
CYUT. Its organization can be divided into Division of IAC Planning and
Administration, Division of IP Management and Licensing, Business Incubation
Center, Entrepreneurship and Creativity Business Development Center. CYUT
Incubator was certified by EC-BIC in 2012 as the first cross-strait
incubator and has been the only soft-landing membership so far. Besides
European membership, CYUT Incubator also holds membership of NBIA, AABI, and
CBIA. CYUT Incubator was awarded number one in Asian-Pacific and number two
globally by UBI World Ranking in 2015.

name: Chittagong University of Engineering and Technology
East West University
description:
East West University (EWU) started its journey in September 1996 with 4 departments, 6 faculty members and 20 students at Mohakhali campus. Now it has its own beautiful campus at Aftabnagar, Dhaka on 7.9 bighas of land and also it has three buildings within walking distance from the main campus. A total of 14 departments are offering 13 undergraduate and 13 graduate programs. Out of 302 full-time faculty members, there are 21 professors and 72 Ph.D. teachers. At present, there are 269 officers and supporting staff altogether.  EWU is the only private university that has received the ICT Digital World Award 2017. The year of 2016 marked an important moment for East-West University. EWU has received the Permanent Certificate ( one of the two universities from 105 private universities) upon fulfilling all the requirements recommended by the Government of Bangladesh. This university is one of two universities out of 105 private universities that have received this certificate. EWU has established an Executive Development Center (EDC) under the support development partner of a project of the Government of Bangladesh, 'Skills for Employment Investment Program (SEIP)'. EDC is now offering a nine-month graduate diploma program. Chairperson and members of the Board of Trustees have been serving EWU with vision, enthusiasm and steadfast dedication since its establishment. The members of the Board of Trustees, faculty members, officers, and supporting staff are working with unstinting goodwill and cooperation. It is the people of EWU who make this EWU such a wonderful institution.

We are squarely focused on establishing EWU as the institution of choice for excellence in learning, teaching, and research and ensuring a high-quality, career-relevant education that prepares students with skills that today’s employers seek. We understand that a university’s role is now not only to impart knowledge but also to develop a holistic approach for producing value-oriented individuals for useful living within society.

The University comprises a distinctive intellectual community. Each member of the University community contributes to the research, education, engagement, and the impact that defines the University and has a meaningful influence on the home and abroad. Our three faculty members received Prime Minister Gold Medals, Two members were editor of the world-class Journal IEEE transaction on Electron Devices and One faculty member is an IEEE distinguished lecturer, three members received UGC best paper awards, three members received Bangladesh Academy of Sciences (BAS) Gold Medal and three members have jointly received the United Group Paper Award 2016. One member was an associate member of Nobel Laureate Dr. Abdus Salam International Center for Theoretical Physics at Trieste, Italy and he has also received ASIA EDUCATION LEADERSHIP AWARD 2016.

Our Center for Research and Training (CRT) and the Centre for Urban Studies and Sustainable Development (CUSSD) are playing a vital role in establishing a research environment at EWU.   CRT and CUSSD are funding a good number of research projects.

We have a reputation for awarding huge scholarships (BDT 110,000,000.00 = ($1309523) annually for meritorious students and also need-based financial assistance.

name: Hongik University
description: The educational goal of Hongik University is to forge the strongest possible link between academia and industry to provide service for the benefit of all humankind. The name "Hongik", translated into English, literally means "service to mankind." The University thus prepares students for varied careers. In pursuing this goal, students are first encouraged to foster independent thinking, free from the influence of others. Intellectual independence is thus our first educational objective. Our second objective is the development of students' creativity. Creativity is vital for individual betterment during one's lifetime, and it is this creative ability that Hongik strives to cultivate in its students. While each individual may live independently, society also requires that individuals live in harmony with fellow human beings. People always learn from the knowledge and experience of others. Hongik University enables students to live in a community where human interaction is essential. This cooperative skill, our second objective, will lead our students to work together for the betterment of humankind. The third academic objective is the development of students' creativity. Creativity is vital in seeking individual happiness during one's lifetime, and it is this creative ability that Hong-Ik strives to bestow to its students.

name: Hue University
description:
Hue Univerisity (HU), formerly known as The University of Hue, was initially established in March 1957. After the reunification of the country in 1975, independent universities were established in Hue on the basis of the existing faculties of The University of Hue. According to the Government Decree No. 30/ND-CP dated 4 April 1994, HU has been re-established by reorganizing all Hue-based universities. HU is responsible for training students at undergraduate and postgraduate levels, conducting research and applying science and technology in a multitude of disciplines to serve the construction and development of the country in general and Central Vietnam and Western Highlands in particular.

HU has 8 member universities (MUs): University of Sciences, University of Education, University of Medicine and Pharmacy, University of Law, University of Arts, University of Foreign Languages, University of Agriculture and Forestry, University of Economics; 3 schools: School of Hospitality and Tourism, School of Physical Education and International school; Quang Tri Branch; 11 research and training institutes, centers and publishing house.

Mission

The mission of HU is to promote the development of Vietnam, especially the Central Vietnam by providing qualified labor forces and advanced and efficient technological - scientific solutions.

Vision

At HU, our 2030 vision is to be among the top-tier research universities in Southeast Asia, operating under the national and regional quality standards; and a pioneer and key training base in the system of regional universities.

Core value system

HU is committed to:

- Embracing Creativity, Standards, Responsibility and Friendliness;

- Encouraging and respecting progressive ideas and creativity by HU staff and students;

- Adhering strictly standards of higher education; establishing, nurturing and developing an exemplary teaching and research environment;

- Valuing the sense of responsibility of the university towards the target groups in particular and social community in general;

- Fostering democracy, solidarity, mutual respect, and respecting honesty and compassion in HU.

Strategic goals

The overall development goals of HU to 2020 and orientations to 2030 are: HU to become a research university; a center for high quality training, science and technology; with a focus on HU's spearhead areas in the fields of health sciences, agro-forestry-fisheries, environment, biotechnology, basic sciences, education, arts; HU's graduates to possess strong political and ethical qualities, to obtain adequate knowledge and professional skills, to have the capability to do research and to apply scientific and technological advances and to actively integrate themselves into the dynamic international workplace environment.

name: Independent University, Bangladesh
description:
Established in 1993,
Independent University, Bangladesh (IUB) is one of the oldest and leading
private universities in Bangladesh where academic excellence is a tradition, teaching
is a passion, and lifelong learning is a habit. For around three decades, IUB has educated and
collaborated with exceptional peopleto provide knowledge leadership for a better future.

IUB attempts to ensure
education to promote the national agenda of sustainable inclusive development
with a current enrolment of roughly 10,000 students at undergraduate and
graduate levels, more than 370 highly qualified faculty members, 64% of whom have PhDs, and an alumni
strength of close to 15,000 members. The students of IUB experience an exciting academic life with
copious opportunities to explore and nurture their innate talents.

Our mission is to achieve the goals of higher education and of
sustainable economic growth in the country through a two-way relationship between community and university.

IUB's goals are to produce
graduates of international standards within the local environment, with
knowledge and relevant skills to provide leadership in enterprise, public
service and welfare; encourage and support useful research; create knowledge;
and provide further learning opportunities for adults. The curriculum
objectives for the undergraduate education are to teach communicative skills
(oral and written communication and computer skills) with a strong humanities
background, knowledge and competence in a subject (i.e. a major), and a sub-specialization (minor) in a related
subject. This is commensurate with the ultimate goal of equipping students with middle management skills and
the background necessary to pursue higher studies.

The University curriculum and
courses of study are continuously revised and adjusted on the basis of the
relevance to national needs and the global market demand. The educational
quality is maintained by exchange relationships with renowned universities overseas. As a private
university, IUB is free to set its own curriculum and methods of procedure and
to cooperate with academics at home and abroad. It produces graduates who are well grounded in the liberal arts with marketable
skills to contribute to economic growth.

name: Indian Institute of Information Technology, Allahabad
Istanbul Bilgi Üniversitesi
description:
Since its founding, BİLGİ has attempted to establish a cultural and scientific community that promotes tolerance and respect for a diversity of individuals with different lifestyles, beliefs and ways of thinking within the framework of contemporary universal values, while at the same time maintaining strong ties with all segments of the society. BİLGİ community includes more than students; it also includes faculty, alumni, families, employers and neighboring communities where BİLGİ is located.

The founding premise of BİLGİ has become ‘to make education more accessible and affordable so that more students can pursue their dreams’. BİLGİ seeks to educate free-thinking, creative, intellectually curious and enterprising individuals who will contribute to a world in which knowledge is accessible to all and, indeed, in which access to it has come to be seen as a fundamental human right. BİLGİ holds a primary responsibility for providing, maintaining and further developing an academic environment in which both students and faculty members are able to engage in learning and the production of knowledge at the highest level.

name: Jadara University
description: The University obtained the initial approval from Ministry of Higher Education as a first step for the establishment on 11 November, 2004. After having completed the standards and official recognition requirements in the subsequent phase of the foundation, it obtained a final license for its establishment in 15 December, 2005. Thus it achieved the desired aim and received graduate students on the first of October of the academic year 2006/2007 to be a scientific tributary that interested in its various programs, the quality of higher education and its superiority to encourage scientific research, and to serve the community and humanity as well as to contribute in the construction of national economy and to promote social renaissance in scientific, financial and cultural aspects. Jadara University aims to achieve a unique position among national and Arab universities in the process of formation and diffusion knowledge and its application to enrich the lives of individuals and contribute to the achievement of sustainable and comprehensive development of the society, the Country and the Nation. Provide a unique education that meets the needs of the local and Arab community, contributes in economic and social development, builds integrated personal for students, and the creation of a conducive environment for research and intellectual creativity, finds an integration between individuals and technology, develops human capital at the university, and openness and communication with the higher education institutions at home and abroad.

name: Jamia Hamdard
description: Jamia Hamdard is the result of the foresight, vision, a rare sense of planning and execution and personal sacrifice of the philosopher-philonthropist, and distinguished physician, Hakeem Abdul Hameed Sahib. It was conferred the status of “Deemed to be University” on the recommendations of the UGC under Section 3 of UGC act 1956 by Government of India in the year 1989. Since then it has steered ahead through all challenges and has gained an enviable position in the field of research and education. With its impressive track record in research, the university has a  distinction of  been consecutively accredited in ‘A’ grade by NAAC in three cycles and has also attained its place in Group I (Institutions Satisfying Most of Criteria for Deemed University Status)  through an assessment conducted by the Committee constituted by the Ministry of Human Resource Development for the purpose of Review of Existing Institutions Deemed to be University. The university is a conglomerate of  eight Faculties with distinct teaching and research programmes which are  spread out at all education levels. Jamia Hamdard  has a rare distinction of  being a seat of higher education in traditional system of Unani medicine, cutting edge Biological and Chemicals Science, Pharmacy, Nursing, Management and IT  and  has been recently fortified through establishment of Hamdard Institute of Medical Sciences  and Research  (HIMSR)  for imparting medical education in modern system  as per the norms of Medical Council of India (India). Paramedical and allied health sciences courses are also offered at with HIMSR. Campus has over 4000 students on campus and over 2000 students are registered in courses offered under open and distance mode and at its off-campus. Another distinguished feature is the presence of on campus  active  research and academic  collaborations with institutions of international Sun Pharma, Vaccine Research Centre of Hilleman Labs Ltd., and BD-JH FACS Academy of Becton Dickinson Biosciences. The University  has substantially contributed in the area of quality research and has  set  high standards for Ph.D. theses and scientific deliberations. The recent addition of an off -campus in Kannur, Kerala  with approval of UGC and MHRD is focused at serving the educationally marginalized communities. In the national ranking conducted by National Institutional Ranking Framework (NIRF) Jamia Hamdard has ranked 3rd and 1st in Pharmacy in 2016 and 2017, respectively. In the University Category it ranked 26th among 724 participating institutions of higher learning. It is also one of the few select universities supported by the Promotion of University Research and Scientific Excellence (PURSE) programme of the Department of Science and Technology (DST), Government of India which is awarded to select top performing universities in recognition of their R&D contribution measured by publications and citations.

name: Kazan National Research Technological University
description: Kazan National Research Technological University is one of the oldest universities in Kazan. Its history dates back to 1890. Kazan National Research Technological University springs from the Integrated Industrial College. On July 14, 1890, the Ministry of Public Education of the Russian Empire enacted the resolution to establish the Integrated Secondary Technological and Chemical Sciences College and the Lower Technical College comprising chemiсal engineering, mechanical engineering and civil engineering departments. The College had buildings for studies; premises for metal works; workshops for technical and chemical experiments; a gas plant; a power station; a residential house for Professors and employees. September 10, 1897 saw the grand opening of Kazan Industrial College. It was equipped with pilot plants for production of soda, sodium sulfate, hydrochloric acid, wood distillation, ferrous and copper sulfate, alum, soap manufacture and glue boiling. Kazan Industrial College had 17 graduations, trained 1145 specialists. In 1919, Kazan Industrial College became Kazan Polytechnic Institute with three faculties: chemistry, mechanics and economics. It was in 1930 that on the basis of Kazan Polytechnic Institute and Faculty of Chemistry of Kazan State University, Kazan State Technological Institute was founded. Since 1935 till 1992 it was called Kazan State Chemical Technological Institute named after S.M. Kirov. In 1919 it was transformed into Kazan Polytechnic Institute and it was 1930, when its chemical faculty and the chemical faculty of Kazan State University formed the basis for Kazan Chemical Technological Institute. Rapid development of institute resulted in its obtaining university status in 1992, when its official name changed to Kazan State Technological University. Versatile activities and success in various priority areas made Kazan State Technological University one of Russian centers in engineering education, research and innovations.
